There too many places in town with better margaritas & service.

I've only done take out from here, but it has quickly become my favorite for Mexican food in the area. Their nachos and green chile dip are amazing. The nachos have tons of cheese on them and the take out size is enormous. I had the fish tacos as well, but they should probably be eaten at the restaurant. They were good, just something that should be eaten as soon as it's served. Definitely looking forward to going in person and trying out their margaritas.
Good casual ambience, with good, but not sensational food. I was not wowed - but also not sad I went in.

Not overly impressed with Cien Agaves, as I'm a true Mexican Food Connoisseur!  I'm all about flavor!  The Guacamole tasted like it came out of plastic bag with a few pomegranate seeds added! Absolutely flavorless, as were the Tinga Tacos, and shredded beef tacos!  My $12 Mimosa Rita was presented well but very under impressive! Service was good, and I'll most likely try this place again, ordering different items next time!

Love their house margaritas! Especially when they are 1/2 off during happy hour!  The tacos are really good.  We really liked the island shrimp tacos.  We also had the chicken quesadilla and the guacamole dip.  All was very tasty.

None of their staff seems very excited to be there ever!  I have been here at all different times and it is always the same humdrum.    This last time I went with a friend of mine for a late dinner.  There was still 40 minutes till close, so it was not like we skipped in at the last second.  You could tell the bartender was not too happy about us showing up.  He offered us drinks and I had to request a menu, then he stood there staring at us while we decided what to order.  We ended up ordering 3 different kinds of tacos.  He failed to ask us if we wanted flour or corn tortillas, and they came out with flour tortillas; I am not a fan of flour tortillas.  It was just not a pleasant dining experience aside from my company.    I can say they have a great taco Tuesday Happy Hour, but otherwise, I would never come here for anything else.

Very good and we even ordered our dinner as take out! Three of us ordered a ten taco package. At first, I did not think it would be enough; however, I was full after eating 3 tacos. The carne Asada and chorizo with potato was fantastic! Note: the menu on yelp is not an updated menu. Also, the pico is spicy (one of my friends does not like spicy things).  Would have been 5 stars if we got rice and beans with this which I thought was supposed to come with the dinner.  Great food.
Really good tacos and margaritas. I'll be back. The beans were great and the rice was good. Becca was so friendly.
Was a great place to just wander in off the street. The workers were very nice. The waitress did a good job. If I lived here I would come back again and again

Heard they had the best tacos in Scottsdale. They were good - not great, but good. Great selection/choices. Chips-salsa weren't impressive (though the red salsa was noticeably better than the tomatillo). Tried 5 different tacos between 2 of us and found them to be just OK/good.

Made a reservation for a Sunday night dinner. Service was good & the food was delicious! Ordered a mango margarita, it was good but the ice was not crushed up enough. The taco selection is awesome with plenty of options! Best part is they didn't go light on the meat fillings!
Basic bar with excellent beeritas and awesome shrimp tacos that were on $2 special Mon night. Very friendly service.

Margaritas were awesome. Service was super fast and friendly. We sat outside by the fire pit it was a gorgeous evening in Scottsdale. Guac was super fresh.  There were 3 of us and we all had 2 different tacos off the menu and were all happy!  I think the carbine asada was the best.

Three words: creamy poblano soup. Even if this place did not have a liquor license I would still drive all the way to Old Town just for the soup. It's seriously one of the best things I have ever eaten. I don't just throw that around, either. It's perfectly balanced and I crave it like I do sushi.  But thank the Lord it DOES have a liquor license, otherwise it would just be called "Tacos." They hand-squeeze fresh limes for every single margarita. It makes for sore hands and more work for the bartender, but it is certainly worth it. It is honestly the best margarita I have ever had (aside from my own homemade ones, of course). The best thing about it is it's $3.50 during happy hour (3-7pm everyday), and happy hour lasts ALL DAY on Sunday during football season. Pretty awesome. I'm pretty in love with this place.  Also on Tuesdays, tinga tacos (chicken) are $1.50 and shredded beef tacos are $1.00 (if I remember correctly, don't quote me on that). Regardless, they're cheap. Also some cheap $2-3 beer deals, but beer is the same everywhere unless you're at a brewery, so whatever about that.  All in all, I love this place. OPEN A TEMPE LOCATION PLEASETHANKS!

This place is a great place to hit up before going to the clubs. Tacos aren't particularly super awesome but they are tasty treats without breaking the bank. They have many variety of the tasy tacos, ex; al pastor & carne asada. To pair up the taco treats. You can enjoy the many varietys of margaritas with their 100 different varieties of tequilas.

Came in at 10:20 pm on a Sunday evening after seeing they close at 11 (been driving around looking for dinner).  Upon entering, the bartender greeted us by saying, "the kitchen is about to close, would you like to quickly place your order"?  Then she shoved two menus into mine and my Fiance's hands.  I questioned the rush and found out the kitchen wasn't closing until 10:45 (why before 11?).    Upon taking a table our waitress also hurried us to order.  When our food arrived at 10:35, the meat in my tacos was room temperature, while my Fiance's meal was cooked well.  The waitress was just a step down from jogging everywhere and rushed every part of the service.  At one point her hurry to clear our table, she knocked over my beer which was thankfully 90% empty by then.    I don't think I'd like return, especially within an hour of closing.  Update: Both of us have had extreme stomach issues since this meal now as well.

My friend and I loved the fajita bowls!! So tasty. Veggies were nicely season and perfectly cooked. We both added chicken and were more than satisfied. We also got the chips, guacamole, and salsa appetizer. Lovedddd the green salsa and thought the pomegranate seeds on the guac was interesting! Never would have thought to do that but it worked. Also loved the decor and the vibe. Would recommend!

I am a huge fan of Mexican food and I can't believe I have not found this place sooner! It's only a mile from my house! The food is amazing....their guacamole is outstanding...stopping on the way home will easy become a habit!

Happy hour!!!!  Ok so not the greatest but still good guacamole pretty good quesadilla was ok margs nothing to write home about.... Jus sayin  Time for fish tacos....... So I visited on Tuesday and I have to say the grilled fish and shrimp tacos are nothing to rave about, very dry chunk of fish with a little mango (i think) pico sauce.

Great ambiance- a nice mix of modern Scottsdale, old school western scottsdale, and latin touches. The tacos are fantastic and the menu is flexible so you can try many different ones. Check this place out!

Not bad Taco/Mexican food place. I had the Chicken Burrito and it was a 6 out of 10. Chips and Salsa were delicious and they have a huge selection of Tequila. I'd love to re-visit this restaurant anther go and update my review.

Great little spot in old Scottsdale.  They have a great happy hour specials and cute patio.  The food didn't knock out socks off but it was decent.    The wait staff was nice, location and atmosphere was good!
Huge margarita , tequila and taco selection  The food is simple and good ! Which is good and large portion . They have great happy hour . I Will definitely be back

They have a huge selection of tequila here. From cold to room temperature, they have it for you, and you can even have them in different flavors. Their tres tacos is a good deal for about $14. Comes with corn chips, two sides of your choice like beans and Spanish rice. You can also mix and match your tres tacos too. They have a fantastic outdoor seating area which at night, it's delightful to be out with your friends, enjoying the nice meal. Service was great, and the staff gave great recommendations.  Until then, Cheers! ~ :p
It's definitely a place for the younger crowd.  VERY loud inside.  I had a couple tacos that were pretty good. The waitress was great.
Thank you so much for the support with Red for Ed movement. Your resturant is great and great customer service. I will defiently be coming back. Thanks again

I have came here multiples times and it's always just as good as the last... amazing margaritas, tacos, and nachos... it goes without saying that the Mexican decor and sugar skull accents make for a neat experience!!!!!
Not the best not the worst. Typical mexmeican bar food. Was not impressed with tortila soup. however burrito was decent.   margs are decent as well.
Chips and salsa were really awesome. They were pretty busy though and dinner took about 25 minutes. Fun atmosphere though.
Great atmosphere...  Started with the guacamole which was very good.  Drinks were out of this world great.  Had shredded beef tacos and enchiladas which were both very good also.
Best place ever! Street corn is so good! Prickly pear margarita is a must! And the shredded beef in the tacos is marinated to perfection! Can't get enough! Don't get me started on the guac and salsa!
Wow!!  I love this place. Always request for Kenzie's section. She's a riot and knows what's best.
Great atmosphere... FANTASTIC GREEN CHILE SOUP!!!!!! just like the one you find in Denver

The bangin'est happy hour (3-7 EVERY day!!) in Old Town by miles, Cien Agaves is everything I thought I hated (the fratty old town crowd), but everything that speaks directly to my soul (cheap and delicious). Margs are never even my go to, but at 4 bucks a pop for a delightfully strong house margarita, how could I say no? Also on HH: half priced apps and $2.50 tinga tacos.   You can't really go wrong with any of their tacos, at least in my experience. Shredded beef and carne asada both excellent, and the island shrimp is a bit of a sleeper hit. But I always come crawling back to the tinga. God, it's just fantastic, especially on the hard shells--I'm not usually a hard-shelled taco kinda gal, but these are the perfect amount of crispy fried perfection.   My one small gripe about Cien is that while the food is all amazing, it's pretty hard to get in and out in a tight hour during lunch time. What we've ended up doing in the past is ordering, and then asking for our checks as our food comes out so we can bounce ASAP. Not the hugest deal, just a bit of a hassle gettin' back to that 9-5. That being said, I've always had amazing service; all of the hostesses, servers, and bartenders are super nice and helpful, and check in often to make sure things are still going swimmingly.  One oddball bonus point: their guac comes with pomegranate seeds! Yum!
Get ready to die of natural causes before you get your food. ......I haven't seen food leave the kitchen since yesterday.

Fairly good and spicy tacos, efficient and polite service. If looking for bar scene this seemed to be happening - went on a weekend evening and it was quite busy and a bit loud, so not for a cozy intimate outing but a fine spot for tacos!

Well, Taco Tuesday is still rolling along here and doing quite well. We were actually seated in that Alley and it wasn't so bad, but on that night a storm was brewing and we nearly got blown away eating. We arrived during happy Hour and tried the plain cheese crisp which was quite tasty with some extra added sauce they had placed on top. The chicken tinga tacos are just $2.50 each and those are all white meat with lettuce, cheese on that hard shell. The beef tacos for happy hour are also budget friendly and still pretty good. The margs are half price, but they continued to be quite watery. A tourist hotspot, so during season might be tough to get seat.
Average Mexican food. Nothing really outside the box for being in Scottsdale. Seems like a very popular hangout. Fajita bowl was mostly black beans.
Taco Tuesday they have shredded beef tacos $2 can't beat that I love the chorizo cheese crisp to die for
Loved this location in old Scottsdale.   Marg options are many!  Cute side patio to sit out on when the weather is cooler.  Have been back a few times.

I have just moved to the area, and was looking for a place to grab a bite to eat.  I was strolling around old town and came across Cien Agaves, and I'm glad I did.  I sat at the bar and the bartender was great, quick service and friendly.  I grabbed the menu and began to peruse the menu.  I saw that they offered many types of tacos and you could do a mix and match of the many different types.  I thought that this was awesome.  I selected Island Shrimp Taco, the Carnitas and the Carne Asada.  I really enjoyed all of them especially the shrimp and carne.  The Carnitas was a little dry, but oh well.  I'll definitely be back and with the many different choice, I look forward to making my way through the taco stand.

My fiancé and I went here for dinner. The place is very cute.  The food was just ok, nothing special about It. But they did have some great food/drink specials till 7pm when we were there. Will I go back for the food? no. The food lacks flavor and that is what makes Mexican food so great.  But I'll go back for margarita.  Overall ok.

Great happy hour and atmosphere. Even  welcomed my service dog in the patio, which had to be entered by walking through the restaurant.   Everything we ate was great. Only disappointment was the avocado margarita-- expected the taste or texture of an avocado. It tasted just like the regular margarita which was half the price at happy hour. Great service. Have been five times and will return for sure.

To Owners, you should really consider covering the bright window so your first booth can be sat around 6!! We got the last booth avail and then saw 3 parties try to sit in the too much glare booth as they were warned by the hostess, and then upset that the only seating left was upstairs.    The happy hour was good, I tried the house margarita, tinga taco, and an al pastor taco as well. I really didn't like how small the plate with the taco was, the tacos were almost falling off of the plate. I eat a lot of tacos at different restaurants and the entire experience was messed up because the 2 tacos were falling into each other on the really small plate. I liked the tinga taco but not the Al Pastor.   Might come back for the atmosphere.

Food and atmosphere are just Ok here.  Probably shouldn't have gotten an enchilada in a more "tex mex" kinda place ... however the service and margaritas are definitely something everyone should experience!

I've been to Cien Agaves twice. Their tacos are great (especially the Al Pastor). Great atmosphere here as well. I was with a large group the last time I was here and they readily arranged seating for us even though they were fairly busy and we did not have a reservation. Over all I would recommend them without hesitation.

Made reservations for a booth, and when we got there we were seated right away. Yesterday we tried to stop in, and get on a waitlist but the hosts were unable to give a wait time which was weird. Our server Sierra was great tonight, but she was getting her but kicked with as many tables as she had. Was also a little strange not seeing a manager that should be running the floor on a busy Saturday to help when needed. Tacos, rice, and beans were mediocre and dry compared to the other visits in the past few months. Nachos were decent.

An annual favorite that just went from 4 to 5 stars thanks to Monika. A favorite Spring Training stop while visiting Scottsdale.  Happy Hour is the best. Monika's suggestions were right on! Started with the Queso Verde and then on to the Cheese Crisp (it's actually a pizza on a flour tortilla.) It was great. Topped off with half price Margaritas. How can you go wrong? We'll be back.  Try the patio if it's not too hot.  Kinda noisy inside.

This restaurant has AMAZING tacos/food but HORRIBLE service. This disconnect makes it very hard for me to make up my mind about this place. I have been 4 times between mid April and mid June.   PROS: A big variety of tacos, a lot of them are unique and combine great flavors you don't see everywhere else. Love the shrimp and the carnitas/pork. Great chips and Salsa. The margs are really delicious and refreshing also - good portion size and no sugary syrup. Nice atmosphere and patio.   CONS: I have had a different server everytime so it isn't just one person bringing down my review. I feel like the servers have to be reminded of what there job is. It should be automatic to bring by chips and salsa or at least ask if the table wants it. I ALWAYS have to request this. The drinks take a while and often the waitress comes back a second time to double check the drink order. Mainly I feel that they are unattentive and just don't put a lot of effort into customer service which is really too bad because it is a great place.  I am not high maintenance and do not ask a lot, but I do like to be served. Whenever I bring someone new here I always add a disclaimer "You will love the food, but just as a warning the service isn't great" so that the person will want to stick around for the course to be served.   I will continue to come here and eat the delicious tacos that I love so much, but will also continue to get extremely annoyed with the staff. This place has amazing potential if they could just work that kink out - it would be perfect.  **UPDATE August 2012 - At the beginning of the month I took some friends here from out of the country. Our food was very good and I am very happy to say that we had great service. I didn't recognize our waitress and I wish I would have gotten her name. She did a great job, was attentive, and was very polite. Made the experience so much better!

This is my husbands and I go to place for great Mexican. Excellent happy hour, tasty margs and large portions! I love the pork chili with a fried egg on top, also the Mexican pizza with pork is HUGE! Love the patio in by the fire place in the winter and the bar area is a great place to kick back and meet up with friends. Tacos come a-la-cart or with rice and beans and there are about 30 different kinds to choose from! If your into tequila they have just about every kind. Staff is friendly and fast. All I know is when I suggest this place for dinner, everyone always is excited to go!

We felt like really good Mexican food in Old Town Scottsdale and remembered this cute very popular  smaller  restaurant. We were seated  quickly. I ordered a wonderful ceviche with big chunks of shrimp.  So fresh and full of flavor. Wow can't wait to come back ! I ordered the 2taco plate with the potatoes. This is the first time I've had a potato taco and I was pretty impressed. The other taco was the mahi mahi also very good.  It also looks like the top area is a good place to have wedding showers and events.

Well that was an interesting set up.  I walked in and sat down at around 12 noon and 2 waitresses passed me by several times never said a word to me. The bartender finally saved the day when he walked over and handed me a menu.  I don't know if he was supposed to play the role of bartender AND waiter  but he did a better job with customer service than the two waitresses did.  The food was good I'll give them that, but I'm really turned off by the over all customer service except for the bartender.

When I found out I was going to Scottsdale for a vacation, I signed up for Groupon and was excited to score a tequila tasting at Cien Agaves! Well, I didn't read the fine print and it was only for the last Thursday of every month.  Not a problem - the owner/manager was great when I told him I had kind of skimmed over the fine print, and he still honored the group on.  We had delicious tacos, yummy margaritas and left thinking how great people in AZ are :)

My husband and I tried Cien Agaves this past week with a groupon. The groupon does not cover happy hour food/drinks so I ordered a margarita from the regular menu. $12.00 and it was all juice. My husband ordered the fried chimichanga which he absolutely loved....I ordered the seared ahi salad ($15)which was utterly disgusting. It was a large plate of a bunch of salad leafs and about 6 strips of ahi. The ahi was not pink at all... and was mushy ewww!  Obviously it was previously frozen.  Lesson learned....order mexican food when eating at a mexican restaurant.

I went into Cien Agave last week because I've heard so much about the margaritas. My server, Anne, gave me an excellent recommendation! She suggested the Cadillac margarita which knocked my socks off it was so good! The food was okay but I would definitely come back for the well crafted margaritas and the fun, perky service! Anne insisted that I try the avocado margarita next time so of course I have to come back!

Average food, awesome alcohol.  I think my experience here is why I have yet to even attempt the food at bar/restaurant fixtures like Loco Patron or Salty Seniorita.  Maybe Cien Agaves tries to shoot for the restaurant aspect a little more - they might have to with their lack of a patio to rival their competitors.    One thing I've noticed about this place is that it's usually dead except on Taco Tuesday.  There's something charming about eating shredded beef tacos and drinking cans of $2 Tecate with a bunch of affluent white people.  That being said, for a buck the tacos aren't bad and there's live music sometimes which I'm a huge sucker for.  The margaritas are good and strong, which is another of my weak points.  If you don't have to work the next day, I'd also recommend the Tequila Flight, which is $18 for three shots of really good tequila.  Speaking of tequila, they have over 100 kinds!  The only place I've seen come close is El Zocalo in Chandler but I don't think they hit that and they certainly don't have an entire page of a menu devoted to the delicious, cactusy drink.  Skip the food, hit the tequila, and don't plan on making a night out of it because it's often dead.

I have been waiting forever to try this place and I finally got a chance to come! I haven't had a prickly pear margarita since I lived in Tucson, and was excited to try this one. It did not disappoint. I came with some friends during happy hour and we had a wonderful time. Kohl was a great server and super sweet. I opted in for the nachos since all of the apps are half off during happy hour and they were Great! Salsas were also fabulous. Can't wait to continue to try more food and margaritas!! The only suggestion I would make is to put more margaritas on happy hour! There are so many options!

It's been a few months since I've been here, and what a change, not for the better. I usually get the same thing to start with, ceviche and pollo asado. Both are usually quite delicious, not this time.  The ceviche had absolutely no flavor to it. As if the chef tried to make it as flavorless as possible. I did not finish it as it was not enjoyable in the least. Now for the tacos. Stale taco shells, dried and overcooked chicken, slopped on guac and no pico de gallo. The tacos were so bad I tried to rescue them by asking for pico de gallo, since they did not put any on, and then I was charged $1.00 extra. Of course, no manager was anywhere in sight. This place simply doesn't care. On the bright side, the margaritas and salsa are still good, but the chips were stale.  Not only will I not return, but I can no longer recommend this place to businessmen from out of town. I see dozens of new business people every day who stay in Scottsdale and they always ask for Mexican food, and I've always said Cien Agaves. No more.

The tacos are top notch.  I have had most of them and can't pick just one to say it is the best! I do like the fish taco.  The avocado margarita is fantastic as well!  I doubt you can find these in many places.
Great happy hour spot. 1/2 price drinks and appetizers.  Friendly staff nice decor. Small enough to talk and enjoy.  Highly recommend.

Just from walking in you know this place is special. There is an immediate positive atmosphere, the food always comes out right and fast, and the service is exceptional. But if you want to feel at home just sit at the main bar and get yourself silly with a Mexican mule, order 1 or 2 cheese crisps and you'll be set.
Awesome bar and margs. We also got chips and salsa for free because we came in before closing on a Monday and had a nice bartender who hooked us up. Nice menu with tons of options!

This was such an awful experience. My first time being here and our service was so rude and unprofessional. Our server Conlin was short tempered and did not seem to give a crap about his job. Any request we had or any time he was thanked he just shrugged us off. We kept trying to give him a chance for redemption, but you can only hope for a change so many times. It was busy, so the wait time was totally acceptable, but having my food be wrong, our table forgotten so we could check out and a completely rude server makes me never want to come back again. This is not the place to go for a good time. If you enjoy rude, cold and unprofessional? Sure stop on in.

The decor was the only thing going for this place. Good service and cool design inside gave it the stars, but the food was very mediocre and disappointing as I love a good Al pastor taco... this one had barely any flavor. Have to say the margaritas were pretty blah as well.

Went here for my sisters birthday and was kinda of disappointed in the place. We had a larger party and our servers were so mixed up and didn't come back for our drinks and forgot to bring out our appetizer.  I'm not one to like spicy food and all the food was extremely spicy to me(personally, others at the table said it was great flavor). However, instead of beans I would totally recommend the corn! Also the prickly pear margarita was delish! Great atmosphere and art. I would like to go back with less people and during happy hour!

BOOM goes the taco dynamite.  My co-workers and I (all of us except the vegetarian, not sure who invited him) thoroughly enjoyed the beef and chicken tacos.  The hard taco shells are the perfect combination of crispy and soft and the toppings were generous.  5 stars, two thumbs up and whatever other positive affirmation you appreciate.   It was a serious work affair, so we didn't get the chance to worked destroy the tequila selection, unfortunately.  Next time Cien Agaves, next time.

March 2018:  GREAT PLACE ... we were there on a Monday night and got seated with no wait (and they were busy).  We ordered margaritas and a beer-rita, a margarita with a beer in it (it was good and only $6 on Monday's).  We all ordered the shrimp tacos ($3 each on Monday's), four shrimp in each taco .... GREAT ... but watch out for the Sauce ... HOT.  Great service and good food.  Try it, you'll like it.

Awesome, awesome, awesome. I tell everyone I know in the Phoenix area that they neeeed to try this place.  After my last review, Katie reached out to me about the issue with my CC and promised to make things right on my next visit. I am not local to the Phoenix/Scottsdale area and really had no plans to come back in the immediate future, so I thanked her for reaching out but didn't really expect much to happen.   Fortunately I got the chance to be in Phoenix for a couple days just a short month later and I knew I would be hitting up Cien Agaves for my tinga chicken quesadilla and house margarita. After sitting down and ordering I mentioned Katie and my server sent her right out - she was awesome and very accommodating and made true on her promise.  I can't speak for the full menu because I literally order the same thing every time (I know - how boring,) but I would expect nothing less than greatness from this place.  The only issues I have are: 1.) I can't go on a regular basis 2.) They don't sell the "green salsa" - seriously y'all need to allow me to order this or share the recipe with me because I am obsessed with it.   Thanks again Cien Agaves, I can't wait for my next impromptu Phoenix trip so I can come back!

My boyfriend and I came here last night after jumping around old town. Nearly everywhere was a 30+ minute wait on a Thursday at 6PM, but thankfully they had bar seats, tables, outside seating and high tops available here.   The bartender was extremely nice and knowledgeable. I asked him if the beans were vegetarian, explaining that I eat fish but not any other meat product. He said that they both were, but was quick to let me know that some other items on my order were not vegetarian and then offer substitutions.   I have never had someone so kind and helpful after asking that question! Even my boyfriend, who has had to deal with my dietary questions at restaurants for years, said he was impressed by how cool he was.   I ended up with two salmon tacos and the street corn. It was one of the greatest, lightest, and freshest Mexican meals I've had in a very long time! This place is fantastic for an array of diners. If you're not that hungry, you can order a single taco or sides.   I can't forget about their extensive margarita and tequila menu! Their house marg is my go-to: perfectly tequila-strong with a splash of lime and sweetness.
My favorite Taco Tuesday in old town! Great shredded beef tacos. Really great deals.

Every Tuesday my girlfriends & I try to go here! They have the best taco's and deal for $1.50 you can't beat them! The staff is always friendly and gives great service! Their house margaritas are surprisingly good too! I would recommend going here any day but especially on Tuesdays!

3-3 1/2 stars is about right. The service was very good, no complaints. The food came out at an appropriate pace and I did not feel rushed at all. I ordered guacamole which was good, not great. Then I got three tacos, two shrimp and one veggie. The menu said the shrimp were hot. I interpreted this to mean spicy. But they were in no way spicy, not even medium. That was disappointing.   My other concern was the outdoor seating. To get a quick seating I agreed to sit outside--they said they had misters and I am really fine with the heat anyway as long as things are shaded. The misters however were pretty extreme. There was a fan blowing a cloud of mist on me the entire time. It was fine at first but got old after a while. Granted I could have requested another seat but I decided to tough it out. But by the end I was honestly a little chilly (yes, in 105 degree weather, amazing to me too).  People who came in after me refused to be seated in the area I was in--they likened it to a rain forest. Note the closer you are to the fan the worse it seems to be.    All in all I was ok with my meal but wonder if I shouldn't have chosen another option in Old Town.

We came here for Happy Hour after leaving the Scottsdale Culinary Festival. It was within walking distance of the Festival, in the shopping district. I got the Sangria and Regular Margarita. The Sangria was ok, not enough fruit at the bottom. The Margarita was good.
Great dinner. Fish tacos were tasty.  Guac was also good.  Chill ambiance.  Siobhan was a great server - very attentive and always with a smile. Will be back.
So fun, really love sitting at the bar hanging out with crazy drunk locals. The tacos are terrific and "The Local" margarita in a pint glass is the way to go.  Marisa loves the ceviche too.

The waitress apparently preferred serving my male companion. The food came out cold. She kept mixing beverages up.  Poor service. Decent food served cold. Sexist waitress.  Just come here to drink, not have a good time.

Very disappointing experience just now at Cien. We are in town from St Louis and were craving Mexican. Got to Cien around 8:35. Hostess told us the only 2 top table was upstairs and "feel free to go up there." We sit at an open table. 5 min later a server asks us if we were seated there, we told her hostess said pick a table. She said we need to go back downstairs to tell the hostess we sat there? So we did. Hostess said "ok great." Didn't give us menus or any further direction. No more acknowledgment from the server back upstairs. So we moved to a high top (it was dirty but only one available) thinking the bartender would serve us there. A busser got the dishes from the table and we were still not acknowledged by any server. At this point it was 8:55 and we decided to leave. No waters, no menus, no acknowledgment. Honestly pretty unbelievable.

Whenever anyone asks me to recommend a great Happy Hour spot in Old Town Scottsdale, Cien Agaves is always on the list! It is right in the heart of Old Town and walking distance from so many fun things to do! Their margaritas & guac are to die for!! It is EVERY DAY, yes, even Saturday & Sunday! ...from 3 PM - 7 PM {I love that it runs until 7 PM, in case your work day runs extra long!} Honestly, what more could you ask for?   HH Specials:  1/2 Price Appetizers  1/2 off Cien Agaves Margaritas  $2 Tinga Tacos  $3 Dos Equis Lager & Amber

I was introduced to this place by Groupon, and couldn't say no because I am such a big fan of Margaritas. It was a great place for lunch with some friends. It's probably great for dinner with a few friends, too. Service was okay, not spectacular but acceptable. I wouldn't recommend walking in with a large group unless you called ahead (if you can) because they don't seem like they could quickly get stuff situated for you.  I had a breaded lobster taco, shredded beef taco, and Prickly Pear Margarita. My friend had the same, but with a POM-rita instead of the Prickly Pear Margarita. All the Margaritas here are made with fresh ingredients (fresh-squeezed limes, etc.) and not some mixes that have been sitting in bottles in the fridge forever. I honestly like the POM-rita better than the Prickly Pear Margarita, but they were both very good and quite large. However, the Margaritas are really expensive. I would recommend coming during happy hour because they are all half-price during happy hour. Plus, appetizers are half-price then, too. And on Mondays, the house margarita is only $3.00 ALL DAY long. I'll definitely be back for some happy hour margaritas and on a Monday off. As for the Tacos, the breaded lobster taco was really disappointing. The sauce they put on it didn't pair that well with the fried lobster, and the pieces of lobster were overcooked and a bit too chewy/dry for my tastes. However, The shredded beef taco was AMAZING. After I started eating the shredded beef taco, I knew I would be coming back for more of them. It's just a classic shredded beef taco with the classic trimmings in a crunchy taco shell (the shell seemed like it was fried very close to when I ate it, yet wasn't oily and they didn't salt it), but they must be doing something a little different because it was just too damn good.   To sum up, I will be back and definitely recommend this place, but if you want to drink margaritas with some of those awesome shredded beef tacos, I would stick to Happy Hour, because the prices are pretty steep.  **Edit: Just found out from a fellow Yelper that they have $1.00 shredded beef tacos on tuesdays. That just moved it from 4 stars to 5 in my book and I will probably spend way too many tuesdays here. Thanks, Lindsey!

Cien Agaves! What can I say? I love fish tacos (tacos pescados) and this well established eatery has several choices. The Tecate Fish Tacos (crispy, beer battered fish) were tasty.  My favorite moments, however, were watching the little birds scour the outdoor seating area for tortilla chip crumbs and listening to the lively banter of the interesting couple that sat near me.
Great margaritas and a nice happy hour, but was not impressed with the food. We had to ask for the free chips and salsa, and the tacos were just blah

Pretty good Mexican spot. I had the fajita bowl with chicken added in. Would've liked more rice, corn and gauc instead of tons of beans and bell peppers personally. Normally get the chimichanga and nachos. Definitely recommend those. Friendly staff and great margaritas. Definitely recommend the Bobs Blue Hawaiian or prickly pear margarita. Nice place for a date or with friends/family.

Te, Te, Te, tequila... Margarita! Holy heaven Cien Agave has the best margaritas in town.  Hottie and I decided to take a seat on the patio during Sunday happy hour to enjoy the Arizona sunshine.  We weren't planning on eating, but after seeing the food being served we decided to give their tacos and some guacamole a try.  I had a veggie taco on a flour tortilla.  It was excellent; they actually grilled up the veggies and the tortilla, giving it the nice crunch of a taco without the frying.  The guacamole was just okay; I've had better and can definitely make a better batch at home.   A good Mexican food restaurant typically has a solid chips and salsa presentation, but their salsa was weak and had gringo written all over it! I'm glad I ended up ordering a taco, because it gave me a better peek into their menu.  We will definitely be back for Happy hour; you can't get a rockin' $3.50 margarita and $2 taco anywhere else in Old Town!

This place is off the hizzie for shizzie. Great HH, Great drinks, the most amazing Salsa. This place has it all. Would definitely recommend to a friend, a friend of a friend and even my grandma.   Thank you Cien Agave for deliciousness every step of the way

I went to Cien Agaves for the first time during a trip to Scottsdale, AZ for a friend's rehearsal dinner. I went to Cien Agaves for the second time, the very next day, because this place is so good!  Coming from Upstate NY, I put all my hopes for a good mexican meal during my short trip to AZ in this place. It is loud in here, with the latest top 40 music playing throughout its two floors. There is an outside patio where you can eat tacos outside enjoying the desert air and a $2 taco tuesday.  The shredded beef tacos were completely addicting and I loved that they dotted the guacamole with little pomegranate seeds (so much healthier!). The tortillas were those homemade corn tortillas that you yearn for in the Eastern states. For my friend's rehearsal dinner, they made mini churros that they turned into a fine display. I'm a sucker for mini churros.  This place is great for a quick mexican platter while passing through Scottsdale. If you are interested in using it for a party, it was definitely one of the best mexican buffet style experiences that I have ever tried. I would definitely come back during my next visit.

Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila does just a couple of things, but they do them really well!  We tried a range of items (blackberry mojito, local margarita, nachos, tacos, rice, beans) but the real stars were - not surprisingly - the tacos and the tequila.   The local margarita is made with a locally-made tequila, and this was one of the best margaritas I've ever had. And the tacos? Nom, nom, nom. We had beef, carnitas, and chicken - and they were all winners. The nachos were okay, and the beans and rice were pretty standard fare.  Our server, Meg, was awesome. She made great recommendations and she totally took good care of us - making sure our food was good and that our drinks stayed full.  And the price? Totally reasonable for the amount of food and all the local ingredients.

I've only been to Cien Agaves once, and it was Cinco de Mayo, so I understandably don't have a good grasp on their day-to-day operations.  However, in a city that is filled to the gills with rip-off, overcrowded, overpriced cantinas on Cinco, Cien Agaves was a breath of fresh air.  We were there in the afternoon with a large group of 20.  We received good service the entire time, cheap and tasty cocktails, and very good tacos.  In my book, that's 3 for 3.

Ventured through a few of the apps most are 3-4 Guac...is a must order, it's always freshly made and if you're lucky or unlucky depending on your spice tolerance you might get an occasional spicy surprise not sure what variety of pepper that was but definitely kicked it up a few notches however the pomegranate seeds balance it out nicely.

I went to taco Tueday last night and started off with a house margarita for half price during happy hour. ($4)  It was very fresh and tart you could tell they didnt use sweet and sour, which is a good thing.  I ordered 2 shredded beef tacos and the Guacamole. The apps are half off also during happy hr which is till 6 pm.  The tortilla chips are A-Maz-Ing, delish.. the red salsa is pretty fab too. The guac is a NO WAY JOSE'. Doesn't taste like fresh avocados, tastes like processed green mush. the tacos were decent they come with shredded cabbage, cheese, sour cream and shredded beef for 1.50 each on Tues all night. I prob wont return didnt really make that great of an impression.

Close to 5 stars.    Food was good, I went w the 3 taco plate.  Battered fish, carnitas and el pastor .  My wife had hashtag veggie bowl w chicken, which she loved.  Staff was on the move and service was quick & solid.

If you're a tequila fan, this is the place for you. Fortunately for me, I have enough sobriety that I was able to breeze past the beckoning of my former friend the agave plant and head straight for the fresh shrimp ceviche with perfectly ripe avocado slices.  The fajita salad did not disappoint, featuring amazingly tender, smoky beef and fresh veggies in an addictively airy tortilla bowl. I ordered the creamy jalapeno dressing, which was a little bit. In retrospect, I would have also ordered the creamy cilantro and mixed the two.  Our server was friendly and appropriately attentive, and we overheard other servers delivering similarly great service.  Only reason for 4 stars was the outdoor dining area was a little plain and dirty, a busboy was smoking outside near the tables, and the inside was overstimulating. But for a tequila bar, maybe those are five-star conditions.

This place was delish! And ironically, it has a happy hour that actually has happy hour prices. I know that sounds funny, but a lot of happy hours are almost just as expensive as regulars prices. But this place is yummy and tasty! 4 house Margis, two tacos, guacamole and tostadas for under $30 bucks. Pretty good! We'll definitely be back

Green salsa was good but little else was.    Sosa was flat, tacos were dry and tasted like they were just reheated from the night before.   Service was slow as well.   I won't be returning and they 5 people I was with stated the same.   Very sad.

I love the atmosphere of Cien Agaves. The place has a really cool feel. There is an upstairs (more traditional tables) and a downstairs (bar and high tops). There is a great happy hour menu and a large selection of margaritas. Chips and salsa, guacamole, and queso are really good. The salad I had was only so so, but my party ordered tacos for the most part which looked amazing! Parking can be a little tricky depending on the time of day since it is in the heart of Old Town, but well worth a visit if your in the mood for a Southwest vibe.
The tacos were so tasteless and we did not get a good service. The waitresses were so confused and stressed.
Great Saturday night vibe. Beer-Rita's are a must! Bring all of your friends. Service is friendly and prompt.

3 Stars only because the house margarita and guacamole was so good.  The food was decent (fish tacos), however the patio atmosphere was a bit sad. I understand this is more of a bar than a fine dining restaurant but the patio tables had no place settings, condiments, etc... Just cheap metal tables and chairs. Also - there was no music out there, just this incessant humming of a back alley generator.    The service was a bit sporadic out on the patio as well. We were asked by three different servers if we have a server yet. Not much in the way of organization.   Maybe management just hasn't gotten around to fully organizing and furnishing the patio yet. I hope they do, because they are in a great location and the food and drinks give them lots of potential.

Go on Tuesdays!  They have $1 tacos... just be sure to have them clarify which ones; not all of them are a $1.  I have been here twice so far and the service the first time was attentive... the second time my waitress seemed a little spacey but got the job done:).  Today I decided to try their house made guacamole which was very tasty and their chips and salsas are not to be missed.  So far I have only tried their shredded beef taco and the chorizo and potato taco... they both were really good.  I have not had a chance to try a margarita yet because I have only been during work... but a see a happy hour in my future and Cien Agave:).

This place rocks on Tuesdays with $1 tacos and cheap drinks.  Try the Lobster Sampler Platter (if you're not going for the $1 tacos on Tuesdays).  Chips and Salsa and right on, everyone friendly, ok for kids in the restaurant section.  Has a little patio, and an upstair couchy loungey bar area (never been there for drinking, but I did sneak upstairs with my son to check out the layout -- it's a habit I have of pacing out real estate!).  Would be a perfect place to rent out for a party or event, probably holds like 40 seated, standing room for another 30 or so).
Looking for amazing flavor, this is the place. Great food amazing prices and large portions. Their pico is amazing. Great place to eat! Really good salsa also. Try it. You will Like it.

I read great reviews about this place, but sadly I was misled. Everything here was a miss. Bad service (it took an hour to get a simple order of guacamole), mediocre food and worst of all substandard margaritas, which is a surprise given the name of the place. An off night perhaps?

Granted, they did take our reservation for 20 just several hours before we were to arrive.....and we did bring in a group of 20 to have dinner and drinks.  Still, the service and food left a lot to be desired.    The two waitress (for our large group) lacked personalities.  The food took foreverrrr......which would seem like a good time to sell some margaritas, but we had to ask for seconds.  Then the food came out, and my rice was cold.    Still, my black bean burrito was good and they kept the chips and salsa flowing and split the checks nicely.   Next time, I'll come with a smaller group.

I used to think this place deserved at least 4 stars but with the new happy hour specials (1/2 off appetizers and margharitas, 1.50 some kinda shredded meat taco that you can get at Juliobertos for a buck Mon-Wed) its gone down to a meh..  Their soda fountain is never calibrated right and now you have to request the complimentary chips and salsa.  Definitely not my favorite anymore!

If you're looking for good margaritas and a fun atmosphere this is definitely the place. The food isn't spectacular, it's sized right for the price.  I had ordered the Poki  bowl and the only thing that actually had flavor was the tuna, everything else in it was pretty bland.  Very cool place for HH though!

We had our daughters rehearsal dinner here. It was such a great experience! The managers did everything to accommodate our needs before the event, including gluten free options for a few guests. Any questions that I emailed to them were answered promptly. And I have to say, this was not the case with other places. We had the upstairs and our own bar. The food was hot, abundant, and wonderful!! If you have a large party,this is the place to go. The price was great too!

This was disappointing.   Service was very slow.   The food mediocre.   The "steak" burrito had a lot of rice.  But there was very little meat.   The street corn is served cold.  I wouldn't ever come back here again.

Great tequila options is the highlight. Unfortunately all four of our orders were just blah. We had to send one meal back as the ahi bowl was swimming in soy sauce. Another meal lathered in cheese. I rarely find a meal that prompts me to give a subpart review. Disappointed to find such poor Mexican in Arizona.

Don't come here if you have a big group, or are hoping for deep conversation. It's pretty small, pretty cramped, and the music is always blaring a few notches too loud.  That said, the food isn't bad for trendy Mexican, and is incredibly veggie friendly (NOT vegan friendly), which I appreciate. Both their red sauce and their tomato sauce, as well as both salsa, both beans and their rice, are all 100% vegetarian. That's incredibly hard to find here in Arizona.  I love the basics; the cheese enchiladas are what bring me back. I've deviated twice; once for the fajitas, and once for the chilie relleno.  Both were ok, but nothing to write home about. My partner devours the chimichanga, and says it's one of the best she's had. Oddly enough, neither of us have tried the tacos, which is what they're known for. Perhaps next time!

Just came from a restaurant that didn't even want to serve me and went to agaves tacos and tequila and had a great Atmosphere and great customer service they  knowledge me right away with big smiles and a welcoming greeting You guys are the best

5 stars for taking great care of our big group of 12. I figured that service for so many people would take forever. Definitely not--drinks came out quick, food didn't take too long, and I didn't see a single wrong order.   Our waitress was awesome. She had great suggestions (get the cheese crisp with carnitas for an appetizer--yum!). She also had no problem with me asking for my mango margarita on the rocks instead of frozen.  Highly recommended for a group.
Food was great, atmosphere and service was fantastic. Meal prices are very reasonable ! Definite recommendation and will return!
I love tacos and Cien Agaves has so many too choose from and they're all amazing!! The margaritas are also to die for!

I went in Tuesday looking for a new Taco Tuesday spot and definitely found my new place. It was delicious and my buddy and I had a great time . The food was delicious and the beer cold. A super solid selection of tequilas turned a great meal into a definite danger will robinson night. All around a wonderful time and the bartender (I think her name was Michael Ann) was hilarious. I will be back on Tuesdays and any other time I need some tacos and wonderful times. Kudos Cien, you have a new regular!

This place is tho!!! GREAT tacos. Fajitas are the best! Margaritas..yummmm. The green salsa is my absolute favorite (tomatillo). I have been coming here for 5+ years now. The food has NEVER let me down. One of the owners is usually on site and you can tell they care about their product. I have recommended this place to numerous out of town friends, and they have always enjoyed the experience.   They have an upstairs area that you can rent out for special events. The atmosphere is perfect for larger parties and fun occasions like graduation parties, work events, wedding showers, etc.  We have rented the space and utilized their catering menu a few times and they have always been very helpful with each event. Very accommodating! Warm staff! You will not be disappointed.
Great place in Old Town Scottsdale!  The food is great, the service is good and it is in a good location!

My first visit to Tacos and Tequila was yesterday.  I seated myself in the bar and was greeted by a very cordial bartender who took my order. I ordered two carne asada tacos, beans and rice which was $11.50 The bartender brought chips, a red salsa & a green salsa. The green salsa was very good.   When my tacos arrived I was very disappointed.  Each flour tortilla had about two tablespoons of meat in it and nothing else. No guacamole or salsa fresca. The rice was kind of just glopped on the plate and the beans were very bland, they tasted like they had no salt or seasonings at all.  The plate presentation was one of the worst I have ever seen and I just felt that whoever made the plate had no love of cooking.  I will not go back. I will say that had anyone asked me how the food was I would have told them how I felt about it... but no one asked.

Pleasantly surprised....Charming decor, good vibe, I was glad they had healthier options- my Beets by Cien were AWESOME & guilt-free!!!! My mum enjoyed her Ceviche after adding more lime juice and the red & green salsas were very tasty.  Will def try again...

Taco Tuesdays should not be missed!  Great tacos, beer and tequila offered for very reasonable prices.  It was our first time in Cien Agaves, pity we had not found it before now.  The staff could not have been more friendly, fun and accommodating!  It is worth the drive from the west valley.
Meh. Was close to the hotel so we thought we'd give it a try. I'm sure my rating would be higher if I drank. Service was good, inside was noisy, salsa and chips were good, food was ok.

I've given Cien Agaves three chances now and they just haven't provided me with anything that makes me to try them again.  I've had the veggie tacos, the fish tacos, chips, salsa, beer and the chips, salsa and beer were pretty good.  This past visit the service was good so that raised it to two stars.  If you are a friend of mine and you want me to come to a happy hour or lunch, do not pick this restaurant.

I love this place for HH but for dinner on the weekends it can be a pain to find parking... pretty typical mexican with good margaritas... no need for me to reinvent the wheel since i feel the same as most of the other reviewers

How have I lived in Oldtown for my entire life and never been here?  This is hands down the best Mexican happy hour in Scottsdale.  Tried it for the first time yesterday.  For $19, this is what my friend and I got: A margarita, a dos equis, nachos, and a quesadilla.  The nachos were huge and they used real cheddar cheese (not the soupy sauce).  The quesadilla was equally large, and tasted great.  Their complimentary chips and salsa had a great salsa verde, although I didn't much care for the red salsa.  Service was outstanding.  Non happy hour prices were on par with other Mexican joints, but I rarely see too much on happy hour at other Mexican restaurants.    I will definitely be back when I can get off work and make it down here before 7!

I checked this place out for the first time the other day and the margaritas were amazing! I highly recommend the habanero margarita. Tacos are delicious too. I wish I had more of an appetite to try the rest of the menu. Service was great! Mimi was our server and she was so funny and really went above and beyond. I will be back and I will recommend this place to others.

Cien Agaves is one of my favorite places to go in the Old Town Scottsdale area, and definitely stands out to me as one of the best spots to go to for Mexican food and tacos :) the service has always been great, and it's in a great location -- just a little bit off the main Scottsdale road.  As for the food, I can't say enough good things! They actually offer complimentary chips and salsa (I don't think enough places do anymore), and the salsa is delicious! Their Queso Verde appetizer is a must-have as well, my boyfriend and I tried it our first time here, and we have never not ordered it since. We love queso in general, but the slow roasted green chile pork they add is amazing :)   I will say that the tacos here are a bit expensive, most are $4-$5 each. They're much better quality here than most taco places though, and are served with a ton of meat and cheese, not just filled with lettuce. My boyfriend and I have tried a ton of different ones, and they've all been really good. I also really like to order the Fajita Bowl with Chicken, I think this is the best way to get a lot for your money. The bowl is only $7 and comes with a ton of rice and veggies, and it's only $2-$5 to add meat.   I definitely recommend trying this place if you're looking for Mexican food! Happy hour lasts till 7 which is nice for after work, and there's a ton of free parking. If you can't find a space right in front, there's a huge public lot not too far down the street.

I went here for the first time as a part of a Yelp event for new hires. My friend Amanda just got hired so I was especially excited to be able to share the experience with her. We went during the afternoon, and it had a very laid back vibe, which I really enjoyed. I only had a beer and some tacos (which were AMAZING!) so my overall experience was somewhat limited. But in the short time i spent there I was definitely impressed, and will be back very soon.

I got the carnita burrito that was huge. It could have had more meat inside but it was still good. The salsa is tasty as well. My buddy got three tacos and said it was really good. The atmosphere is great as well.

I only ate 3 things at Cien Agaves so that is was this following review is based on.  1. The chips and salsa are great. People were saying it was too watery, but I disagree it was extremely flavorful with great chips.  2. The classic margarita is 100% perfect. Not only was the taste perfect but they didn't wimp out on the tequila. The color was spot on.   3. The carne asada taco. One word, delicious. I think this might be the best taco is the valley. Everywhere I go I try their carne asada taco, and this place was by far the best. I am just unhappy it took me this long to find Cien!!!  I will return.
Highly recommend. Great drinks and tacos.

Made it just in time for happy hour. Happy hour is from 4-7 EVERY night.   Our fantastic server Anne recommended a Tequila. Maybe the best Tequila I have ever had the chance to taste:  Herradura Cien Agaves Single Barrel Reposado    Ask for it cold!***

Me and a group of 9 friends decided to come check this place out before our movie! It took about 10 minutes to get our drinks that we were never ID'd for after ordering and our waitress mixed all of our margaritas up. I didn't catch her name as she never introduced herself. It was a young black girl serving upstairs. By the time the food came out some of us were missing tacos, shrimp, sides, etc and all of our waters were empty!! We asked the bartender to grab us water and he did promptly.  the food was absolutely delicious!! I was very impressed. I wish we had more time to enjoy but the service was so slow that we were late for the movie.  Our server was standing at the POS for 10-15 minutes trying to get our checks but my friends grew so frustrated that they lined up in efforts to pay so she would stop getting distracted. I then watched her whisper to the bartender how "annoying" we were. What's really annoying is having poor service ruin an entire meal that was so promising. Keep up the good work, chefs!

Cien Agaves is a great option for good food and good vibes.  The thing that sticks out to me is how consistent they are.  Like it's always good, never bad.  I love their tacos, and fajitas. Chips and Salsa is FREE praise the LawD!!!!!  Cien Agaves keep doing what you do, thanks for being someone I can count on!

THE BEST! My friends and I have been coming here for a of couple years and it is hands down our favorite spot, especially for nice spring/summer days eating outside on the patio. The decor is great and the music is always perfect for the atmosphere.  The cucumber margarita is a must try and you can easily fill up on the chips and salsa.  I don't eat meat but my friends love the tinga tacos and I am a fan of the veggie tacos and fajitas. The guacamole and nachos are also great! They have a vast selection of tequilas and a tequila hall of fame.  If you want to make the hall of fame just ask the bartender how and they'll give you all the details. It's a great way to explore and find your favorite tequila.  They also have lots of events and specials like taco tuesdays and margarita mondays.  I take all friends and family from out of town here and if/when I move, this will be the place I miss and crave the most! :)
I was craving some good Mexican food. This place delivered had great burritos and tacos and lots of choices with all the drinks

There is lots to love about this place, and I want to start with the service, attentive, friendly, and gracious. Our servers took such great care of our big table on monday night, that I have to give the place 5 stars before even one plate of food was served.  About the food we planned the visit around Cien Agaves terrific Happy hour, so there were lots of tico tacos $1.50 ea and half price appitizers on the table, rounded out by a few entrees. Everything I tasted was delicious, especially the Chicken Quesidilla. Normally I would skip a chicken Quesidill on almost any menu, but I am so glad I didnt this time. Just the right mix of seasoned Chipotle Chicken and Cheese in a huge folded and grilled tortilla, with sour cream. This is by far the very best restaurant quesidilla in town. Everything served was great, and raves about the food came frome everyone.  They have great drink specials during happy hour as well, including 1/2 price margaritas and special priced beers. It's the tequilla selection that is special though. It's an amazing selection of some of the best tequillas in the world. You can even try some tequilla flights!  Inside the place is funky/cool, super clean, with some really cool art and lighting. In Old Town There are some real GEMS and a few DUDS when it comes to mexican food, but Cien Agaves might just be the very best choice for Mexican food in Scottsdale.  I MUST SAY TO MY FELLOW YELPERS---GIVE THIS PLACE A TRY!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Friendly, airy place. Modest menu, ok quality, spotty service, ok prices according to the people I was with. LOUD. I mean LOUD. Don't go there if you want to have a conversation.
A little taste of mexico in old town!  And we all know how I love mexico!  Good everything, service has always been great, and I love their happy hour specials!

I first came here many years ago and remembered the happy hour food was good, so on a recent trip back to Scottsdale, I was in need of some good food but didn't know where to turn. I was one block away from Cien Agaves, so I came back to try it again. I got the two taco special with soft flour shell and carne asada. Comes with typical beans and rice. These are without a doubt the most flavorful tacos I've ever had. It's like a taste explosion! I think some of that comes from the fresh guacamole they put on the tacos.  All their other food looked great too, and people seem to love it.  Definitely give it a try. There's a reason they've been here in business so long!

Got invited here by a friend who just started working here....was really busy do we sat at the bar. The queso was amazing. Had pork in it. Not really a pork guy but it was tasty!! Damn good. The steak burrito with green chili was also really good. I can usually finish my plate but today I did not! Great portion size! Kenzie was our waiter. Awesome and patient with all our questions! Great first impression. I will be back!

This place is a good spot for happy hour.  Tuesdays are taco Tuesdays, so you can eat for a reasonable price for the entire family.  Service isn't the greatest, but overall, it is a place that we would return to.

Cien Agaves was a chill place to have a margarita after work, kick back with the locals and get to know the staff.  The rating is more like a 4.5.     The tasty seared ahi taco inspired this haiku:  I walk across sand And find myself sweltering In need of a drink  The salty rim calls My dry mouth is quickly quenched As Richard brings chips  The local spouts off And teaches new crude phrases As the staff shakes heads  Margarita three Thoughts of a supposed friend prompt melancholy  Then regulars laugh the seared ahi taco arrives culinary hug

AVOID THE TEQUILA TASTING. Unless you really just want shots (not tasting), standing in long lines,  and being surrounded by copious amounts of drunken twenty-somethings.   I bought a "Google Offers" for tequila tasting for myself and a friend. I had called to see how it was ran and what to expect. I was told it was similar to a wine tasting experience. LOL! We went upstairs to the bar area, where two elongated utility tables were out. There were two representatives offering (approximately) two ounce shots in small, plastic "sauce" cups. Which, by the way, we never did experience.  We gave up and left after waiting (standing) in line for fifteen minutes. It was more aligned with a keg party.  Not that we were upset, since instead of a sipping and a true tequila experience, we were really in the middle of a "free shot" until you get really, really drunk experience.  We left and headed over to the grapevine instead. Excellent patio, decent cocktails, (unfortunately a poor tequila selection, but that's not what they are known for).   I do have to say, the manager was kind in an email, but we won't be visiting here again.  I can't comment on the food. 1 star for misrepresenting what they are offering, 4 stars for management. 5 stars to Google Offers for giving me a full refund without any issues.

What a great lunch! Walking around old town and discovered this Mexican place! Fantastic fajitas and Cadillac margaritas. The guacamole was pretty good, needed a bit more flavor. Samantha C did a great job as our waitress! We will be back on our next visit to Scottsdale.

We were looking for a place with Prickly Pear Margaritas but saw the Mai Tai on the menu and had to order it. Yummy. Had several appetizers which were Happy Hour specials. All good but served on the lukewarm side.
Great service, friendly waiters and cool atmosphere. The prickly pear margarita is really good and so is the fajita bowl! Definitely worth stopping by for lunch or dinner.

Would I go back here if/when I return to Scottsdale? Heck yeah!!!!!  When we were there last November there were 5 adults and one child in our family group wandering around the area looking for something to eat.  The one place we tried to get into you couldn't get in without a crowbar so we wandered past this, took a look at the menu and said why not!  So glad we did!  Good sangria, interesting patio area (felt more like an alley but cool), great chips and salsa, and good food at a good price.  No one, not even the kid complained about their food.  And this was the first time in my life I had fajitas with zucchini in them! YUM!  Plus, most veggies that come with fajitas are usually limp beyond limp and on the bland side.  Theirs had some spice to them.    With drinks and food our whole bill for all of us was around 100$.  Not bad for a place in Old Scottsdale.

Poorly mixed margaritas, which is weird when you consider that is supposedly the house special. There is no raw fish taco anywhere in Mexico, unless you don't have a fire. We didn't get quite what we ordered. First and last time there.

Visiting from New York we wanted something 'authentic' to Arizona while walking around Old Town Scottsdale and this place seemed to fit the bill.  I ordered the Fajita Bowl.  On 'paper' it didn't seem like anything amazing - rice, beans, citrus marinade grilled veggies and guacamole on top - but it was vegetarian and seemed filling so I went for it.  This is an example of where a humble meal, prepared well, ends up besting something else that's got a sexier name or more exotic ingredients.  It was perfectly seasoned, with just enough 'heat', everything tasted fresh, the rice and black beans were soft, the grilled veggies REALLY did have a marvelous citrusy lemon-lime flavor and the guac provided a lovely counterbalance to the heat of the dish.  Healthy, tasty,with a texture that was both chewy and soft.  Perfect and at $7, it seemed like the best deal in town.  You can order it with some protein on top for a bit more too.  The services was friendly and atmosphere very SouthWestern.  If I was local, this would become a regular thing.
Excellent food, super service!! Best guacamole ever!!!  Waiter was quick to come by and add water to our glasses and check if we needed anything. I strongly recommend this place!!

Ordered:  al pastor, shredded beef & carne asada (& churro sundae) A+ for all 3!  The pineapple in the al pator blended great with the smokey taste of the pork.  Both beef tacos were superb.  We wanted to try the spicy shrimp one, but decided to save room for the CHURRO sundae : ) YUM! and good thing we did - it was excellent! BF liked the green sauce more, it was sweeter.  On the flip side I preferred the red sauce - it was a bit spicier, and a real treat since I normally ALWAYS prefer green salsa. Also got the grilled corn which was a bit of a let down - it seemed boiled, not grilled, but oh well.  They have lots of specials and if it were later on the evening (as opposed to the early lunch when we were there) we probably would have sampled some of their tequilas/margaritas. Would definitely go back/recommend. Service was great too - no complaints!
Great atmosphere and good food! Highly recommend this spot in old town scottsdale for happy hour or dinner!!

Had a fun dinner with coworkers on their Taco Tuesday, which can be a great deal with $2 chicken tinga tacos, half off their house margs and half off appetizers. Now, none of us partook in those deals (hello, expense account), but we still loved our dinners! Most of us did their two taco plate with beans (refried or black) and Spanish rice, but you could do three tacos, 10 or even 30 for $38, or something like that. You can also pick flour or corn tortillas. They had 20 or so funky taco choices so it was hard to narrow down, but I tried their seared ahi taco with chipotle jicama slaw and avocado as well as their spicy shrimp taco with rice and guajillo sauce ($4.95 each). Guajillo peppers are my jam and though the rice sounded weird on the menu, it worked, but maybe needed an additional sauce to jazz it up and make it less dry. I had an amazing habanero lime marg ($12), okay two margs, but they had a ton of options including cucumber, other fruits, beer margs with a bottle out the top and even skinny versions. Other meals on the menu included fajitas, enchiladas, salads, quesadillas and some yummy sounding bowls like the "beets by Cien" which, in addition to two colors of beets, also has shaved Brussels sprouts, chimichurri sauce and dried cranberries I think (could add proteins like chicken, steak, shrimp or salmon). Lively joint with two floors and lots of color inside. Great service that handled our large party spread across two tables and got us out in time for our next activity. Fun area in cute Old Town!

We are from Portland, Oregon and spent a week in Scottsdale during December 2013.  Of the 7 nights we dinned out, we went to Cien Agaves 4 nights.  Everything is absolutely excellent- including the service, prices and especially the quality of the food and drinks (the Happy Hour food menu and drinks are fantastic!).   The atmosphere and seating offer something for everyone.  Indoors for the music and energy, outdoors for the wonderful desert air and a little more quiet while enjoying the warm heaters.  My only regret:  that Cien Agaves is not in my own city!  Check it out, you won't be disappointed!

Had the tacos on special.  Yum... good stuff.  But they really felt like "cheap" tacos.  They arrived a bit wet and could not be picked up with your hand without ripping through the tortilla.  Guacamole was good.    Dining area was okay.  A bit loud.  I will probably be back, but mostly because the price is right.

1 + 1 + 1 = 4  Sometimes, like at Cien Agaves, the sum of the parts adds up to more than each individual part.    Mexican food was on the minds of my party of 4 and the first place we tried claimed an hour-plus wait despite appearing 10% full.  It was a blessing in disguise really, as Cien Agaves was much more what we sought:  a busy casual environment,  inexpensive fare, zero pretension, and no attitude.    During a brief wait at their upstairs bar, we learned it was Happy Hour and that theirs was voted "best of" by readers of Phoenix Magazine.  How could it not, with 1/2 price Margaritas, 1/2 off all appetizers, $3-$4 beers, and Tinga Tacos priced at $2.50 apiece?  The fact that it's every day from 3 - 7 p.m. just improves the value proposition.    Margaritas were in demand and many sat pre-made, at the ready.  Large but not refined (and made in advance without salted rims), I really wasn't going to complain loudly about a big $3 cocktail.  It was good enough, a category into which the rest of the offerings could also be said to fall.    At the table, chips and salsa were provided and an order of HH Tinga Tacos proved greasily satisfying.  The rest of the offerings followed suit.  During happy hour it's difficult to resist all those cheap appetizers so I can't really complain about them serving up fatty foods best designed to sop up alcohol.  It is, after all, what I ordered.    Cien Agaves doesn't serve the best Mexican fare but what they do serve - at happy hour in particular - is well priced, good at filling you up, and your server will throw no shade even when your whole party orders from that happy hour menu.  That counts for a lot, thus the new math, where 1+1+1 = 4.
Chicken tinga tacos were delicious. Great happy hour prices. The Local margarita was made with fresh limes and a very smooth tequila. The chips and salsa were very fresh.

Last night was my third time to this fresh and well-spirited (both figuratively and literally) tequila bar. It has not disappointed...  Aside from the pretty but grumpy hostess, I have nothing but praise and accolades. The tacos have been amazing each time, the fajitas had that smell that just makes you inhale and savor, and the tequila collection is probably the best I've seen - over 100, mostly high end blancos, repos, anejos and even some of the best (still in production) XAs around. 100 tequilas in a year and you're considered royalty with a picture on the bar and happy hour pricing for life - if you're from Phoenix why aren't you already there? Heck, I only come into town now and then but I'm aiming high. Like I said, the best shelf around.   The servers have been super friendly and attentive, the 'tenders each time have stopped mixing just long enough to say "hey" when we walked in. I'm giving the service 4.9 stars (just that hostess that one time...)  Parking is easy, the place is fun. If you haven't come for a tequila pour yet, you're missing out.  "DJ 1942 neat, please?"

It's a cool place! More for the kiddie crowd. Everyone trying to be all like that! Cool, or "I'm the most beautiful girl in the world" mode! Wife and I started with the Los Nachos, This was my favorite of the night! Chips piled up high with black beans, chicken, pablabo sauce and cheese! I ordered their Al Pastor tacos, wife had their beef tacos. Al Pastor was just OK, if you ever had Al Pastor, you know what kind of explosive flavor it should have! This one didn't!! Wife's taco was actually better then mine! It had shredded beef that was soaked in its juice, in a fried shell. Very good taco. Tacos come with beans and rice. Rice wasn't that good, tasted like it came out of the box. Beans had no flavor, NOTE!! Black beans were a lot better!!! We also shared a prickly pear margarita, very strong! (glad we shared it!!) I have had better. We had a good time, service was great all away around! If I was back in the area, I could see myself going there again.
The tacos are the best thing on the menu and reasonably priced. Get at least two, and probably three of you have a big appetite. The sangria is excellent and is freshly made with crushed fruit.

Art is amazing ... 100 % Puro Moises. Food is barely edible. Margs are watered down sugary mess. Was excited about the green chile cheese crisp with carnitas which the waitresses recommended but the green chile had zero favor. Overall a disappointment.

My absolute favorite margarita place in Scottadale and possibly even the valley! Their tequila selection is incredible, so much to chose from. If you are a tequila lover like me, check out Cien Agave!

I loved this little place in Old Town Scottsdale!! Such a fun vibe. They have a great happy hour every day with half off all appetizers and house margaritas. The margarita was delicious!! I had the ceviche to start which was good but the Ensalada Del Mar salad was amazzzzzing. I topped it with grilled salmon and the chipotle vinaigrette dressing. Although the waitresses had zero personality the service was super fast. Highly suggest stopping by if ever in the area. Such a fun and cute place

Please give this restaurant a try. You will not be disappointed. I had the Mahi-mahi Burrito Bowl and it was delicious. Try The Local and The Cadillac Margaritas. Siobhan B. Is a great waitress. She was nice and made great food and drink recommendations. It's good

Great atmosphere! Their mango tango margarita was delicious! Staff was nice. Food was great. I didn't make it on time for their happy hour when I was in town this time. Prices for drink wasn't bad without happy hour. I did get to peak at thier happy hour menu and I would deffinetly recommend. The prices looked great. This is a place I would make it a point to visit when I am back in town again.

My favorite Mexican restaurant here ( in Arizona) ... you can not miss the happy hour on the weekends. The services is amazing, and if you do your reservations you don't need to wait in line to get in. Entres such as "queso verde" and "nachos" are a must!  And it's always fun to have eliges with the figures they have as decorations ( similar to Coco, the movie)

Horrible!! The food was gross, and after bringing me the wrong item twice the server didn't even offer to take my meal off the tab. We were the only table in there and the server messed up everyone else's order too. When it was time to pay he got every bodies tab wrong, he handed me my tab at 8:00 and then grabbed it out of my hand. By the time I payed it was 8:30 and I'm sure it was the wrong amount but by that time I just wanted to leave. Also they brought the birthday girl her cake after most if the party left.

What's not to love about this place?  Many choices for great tasting tacos, great atmosphere and hot waitresses.  I swear mine must have been a super model!!! LOL, you can tell I was impressed.  This place has a nice menu with many choices, its a little high end as far as pricing, but the quality is very good with so many combinations of tacos that you can get.  The particular visit, I had one fish taco only because I ate before, but I have been here before and the food is excellent.  If in the area, definitely give it a try.
Ate here last night with family..the food was just OK..atmosphere was loud and crowded..service was OK..the house margarita was fantastic..
Our go to Mexican place - happy hour every day from 3-7!! Their margaritas are my absolute favorite and their food never disappoints. We love this place!
The food was just OK as well as the margaritas. The outdoor seating looked to be a good idea but when you have a bunch of college kids getting drunk in the same area it wasn't such a great spot.

This was our first (and last time) going here. We wanted a taco Tuesday. A friend recommended it to us. We sat for at least 15 with nothing. Got our drink order filled. No chips or water for us.
