Both salsas were very good, nice and fresh. The red salsa was spicy, which I love.  The chips were sub par in my opinion. Some crunchy, some chewy and tough.   Everyone at our table ordered a variation of the two taco meal. The variety of taco options was very good.  I had a carnitas one and a shredded beef one. Carnitas one was very taste, and I liked that I got the option of a soft corn tortilla instead of flour. The beef taco was served in a special shell, I did not care for it. It was a fried corn tortilla that was a little hard to bite into, and did not have a very good taste.    I love trying New Mexican places when traveling, this one unfortunately was a slight disappointment.

Just arrived in Scottsdale and a bartender recommended this place for tacos. We didn't get the tacos which looked great as they went by.  Had a chimichanga and a burrito.  No side rice or beans? Average

Quite possibly the most disappointing taco bar ever.  Looked promising on the outside.  Street tacos were skimpy on the protein portions,  way too sweet of garnish in most cases, and the grilled fish taco was incredibly bitter.  We loved this concept at Joyride Tacos but not so much here.
Perfect lunch spot for our family. The margaritas were great. The food looked spectacular - but the flavors were just a little below par.

We were really pleased that we stumbled on to this place. It happened to be happy hour & the prices were very good. For dinner we had a ahi, shrimp, and grilled fish tacos & a chipotle chicken quesadilla. The habenero margarita was delicious and not as hot as I expected. Loved  the up beat atmosphere. We will definitely be back.
The food here was very good.  They also have an excellent tequila menu.  The service was a little grumpy but I found that in almost all of the restaurants in Scottsdale, must be a Scottsdale thing.

This is an awesome mexican restaurant. The food was wonderful and the staff went out of their way to give us a memorable experience. We had reservations , and the table was not vacating. We waited 20 min. The staff set up a delightful table for 7 people outside,they brought in heaters and lit the Fire pit. Lovely atmosphere for making us wait. The staff, brought us delicious apps. And after our meal they brought desserts. Very kind of our waiter Connor, who took good care of us. Thanks Connor for a great night.
Happy hour is too good to miss! Food is pretty standard (good) Mexican with a solid location and great specials.

We came back to this place for the second time for a happy hour. The waiter was very nice and the food was OK. Some good deals. Very loud but they have a cool bar area upstairs, that is very nice. I'll go back to keep some variety but nothing special.
Awesome tequila list. Enjoyed variety of tasty tacos. Friendly and fast service. Staff opened early when they saw a line starting outside. That is impressive customer service.
So good! And the staff was super knowledgeable about the tequilas! The carnitas tacos were tender and delicious and the guac was spicy and perfect!

Went to dinner for the first time over halloween weekend. Our server was great! She was very attentive, knowledgable, and fast. The tacos were rather spicy. With all the Halloween dressed individuals, the service was still great, and I will definitely be back!

I had 3 of the best tacos of my life here! Island shrimp taco, Al Pastor (with pineapple!), and the tinga taco pretty much blew me away. And you cannot beat the Sunday $5 milagro margarita deal. Great cantina vibe in this joint, plus plenty of screens to watch football on Sundays. And best of all, the salsa was actually spicy!
This place has great margaritas and tacos!!! Audra was our server- whom was amazing! Audra  brought our service dog a bowl of water and we sat inside.  We will be back here!
Excellent food & service. I had chicken tacos and my husband had chicken fajitas! We left with smiles on our faces and full bellies. I highly recommend this Old Town Scottsdale special.
Definitely a MUST try! Great service! Awesome HH from 3-7 with half off apps and hours margaritas. Join me next time!

Do yourself a favor and don't go in the last hour they are open because I just had a very mediocre service and the thing was our server was friendly her name is Kylie but it took forever to get greeted forever to get chips for ever to get refills and she never even bussed our tables left our dirty plates there the entire time.   The food was really good otherwise it probably get it one or two stars in fact I got the extra third start just because the churros Sunday was so amazing  Someone did say in Kylie's defense she was the only server in the whole restaurant I don't know but that shouldn't be my problem anyways. There was a Giants night game so they should of staffed accordingly

I ordered food for take out. I got two tacos, the shredded beef and the carnitas. The carnitas was very good. It was very overpriced, though. It would be a good date spot. I was looking for authentic and cheap, this was not the place for that. But, like I said, it was good and would make a nice date spot.

I like this place. It has a good feel and delicious margaritas. If I were back in Old Town, I might stop by. But I am sure every neighborhood has their own margarita spot that is quite similar. There is no reason to drive for miles to get here.

I'm craving a Tinga taco just writing this review.  I love Cien Agaves' tacos!  You can order them individually, as part of a meal with beans and rice, or a platter of 10 for $35.  Pork, carne asada, chicken, potato, lobster..you name it, they have it.  Whether you like mild or spicy, are not a meat eater, whatever... You'll find the perfect taco for you.  Their patio is basically a narrow walkway with wobbly tables.  That's the only negative here in my book.
Decent food and service..did a tequila tasting and the vendors were extremely stingy..maybe next time they ask the vendors to give at least half an ounce?  I'll give them one more chance..
This place is definitely under rated. I had the 2$ shrimp tacos on Tuesdays. It was worth more than I paid for it. I would recommend this place.

An awesome place for Taco Tuesdays.  I went to two different Mexican food places during my stay in AZ for Taco Tuesdays and Cien Agaves was wayyy better.  The tacos were delicious.  Add in a $2 brew and I was a happy camper.  Service was better than most. Very upbeat restaurant.

If you want to try some of the best margaritas for the best price you have to come here.  The happy hour is awesome. My boyfriend did the tequila challenge and now his Photo is displayed at the bar. They have really good tacos as well.

Sat at bar and had the best service.  Terrific bartender. Great margaritas too!  Didn't eat and was just there for drinks but everyone around us were ordering food and seemed to enjoy it!  Will have to dine there the next time we're in town.

We had an after our rehearsal dinner meet up here with all of our friends who were in town and weren't invited to the dinner. We called ahead and reserved (although not exclusively) the top floor for our party. A bunch of friends decided to stop by before hand for food and were raving about it! The rest of us came over in huge groups from the dinner and the staff was ready for us.  Upstairs, we had two bartenders and the manager informed me that she had chips and salsa out for everyone to snack on...even though we just ate, everyone appreciated the thought and they were gobbled up! The bartenders were bad ass! They handled the massive wave of people like pros and had smiles on their faces the whole time. Thank you guys so much for doing such a great job with our party!  I had actually been here 3 years ago when I first moved and remember really enjoying the food as well, but the decor and service is what reminded me of how great this place is both for just hanging out and having a huge get together. I would highly recommend the top floor for a group like ours as long as you plan ahead and coordinate with their team because they are happy to accommodate and I would recommend stopping in even for a drink since they have some killer margaritas!

If you are looking for a great street taco look no further..CIEN AGAVES has them.  Their entire street taco menu is mouth watering however I can never stray from the lobster tacos.  This place is a great place to go to before an afternoon Spring Training baseball game.  Their three tequilla taster is also a good way to sample the tequilla, if I can remember it is around $16 for 3 shots (heavy pour) of tequilla for sipping.  This place continues to get better and better and the service I recieve there is how any place in Scottsdale should be.

Loved the happy hour specials! Between the two of us, my boyfriend and I were able to enjoy two of the Cien Agave Margaritas, a Tecate beer, the Guacamole appetizer, the Nachos appetizer, a Tinga taco and a Diablo taco all for under $35.00. Will definitely return to Cien Agaves when I'm back in Scottsdale!

So many great things to say about this place where do I begin....  WITH THE HOUSE MARGARITAS OF COURSE!! Hands down THE best house margarita I have EVER had. No syrups or mixes, this is straight tequila and lime juice baby, very refreshing and delicious! And for 4 bucks on a Monday evening, how can you go wrong?  Their specials are all very good: Margarita Monday (as mentioned) with half price Apps, and Taco Tuesday with their dollar tacos and $2 tecate's...HELL YA.   They have a great range of tacos here and all are pretty delicious. Try the nachos with Al Pastor on them too, delicioso! Their chips and salsas also kick ass.   If youre looking for a low key place to hang out, snack, and drink then you'll enjoy this place and if you love margarita's then you'll REALLY enjoy this place

I checked Cien Agaves out with a coworker last night and we LOVED IT. First things first: everything tastes very fresh. The salsas and chips were great, and we tried the cucumber margarita, prickly pear margarita, and the habanero marg, and they were all good, made with the veg/fruit/pepper FRESH.  We just had nachos but they were plentiful and mighty tasty. Big fat slices of jalapenos on top and visually appealing.   The ambience isn't uniform in places (mixing early 90's modern furniture with homestyle Mexican decor and art), but it's just subtle enough to not be incredibly annoying. The male staff were very cool and relaxed, but the females were a little bit "in the way"... eavesdropping, it seems. We were one of 2 couples in the bar, though...  Regardless, this place deserves 5 stars. It's a very delicious, very easy Mexican choice in downtown Scottsdale.

Great Mexican joint in Old Town Scottsdale! Visited last night with my friend and we were pleasantly surprised. There was a 30 minute wait since we didn't have a reservation, but we decided to sit in the bar instead. At first the service was a little slow, but as dinner went on it was much better.   We both just ordered soda, so I cannot comment on the margaritas, but the bartender was cranking them out and they all looked delicious! Such a variety of tequila and drinks on their menu.   We started with the guacamole which was very fresh and topped with pomegranate seeds. It's the perfect combination! Their salsas were a little too watery, but good flavor.   There were so many things on the menu that we wanted to try, but decided on the Steak Burrito with refried beans and the Combo #5. The burrito was huge and covered with red enchilada sauce. The steak was cooked well and the beans were definitely homemade which is a huge plus for me. The Combo #5 was a Tinga taco, cheese enchilada, beans and rice. Everything was a hit!  Will definitely return to try some of the tacos and the happy hour which is every day from 3-7pm!
Solid happy hour! Great food and drink specials. I really love the art on the walls.

Since we found this place a few years ago, we come every time we're in Scottsdale. The tequila selection is the best around and the hosts are always very knowledgeable and helpful in offering suggestions. Plus the food is amazing. I always have a chimichanga, my wife and kids get other dishes, and we all get some appetizers--everyone absolutely loves everything we order. Love, love, love this place.
We went here for my sons 8th birthday. The food was great and so was the service! It wasn't overly expensive either and the noise level was moderate. I would definitely come back here!

Been wanting to stop in this place for HH for awhile and I FINALLY did recently. Unfortunately, our group came here AFTER trying HH someplace else first where we were less than impressed, yet had a couple drinks and a little food in us, so I didn't try as much as I would have liked to.   The only food I had was the queso dip and it was SO GOOD! We ordered two servings for 6 people and I'm pretty sure I ate almost an entire order myself. Oops. The green chile pork added into it was delicious!  One of the girls I was with had a couple tacos and she said they were very good. I hear the guac hear is delicious, and I'd like to come back for it.   I obviously had a margarita as well. It was good, and tasted even better half price during HH :)  The restaurant itself is nice. It's two stories and I believe there's a bar on both stories. Lot's of seating and our service was great.   I'll come back.

It's Friday afternoon beautiful day out decided to walk down the street from our home in old town! Took the kids out enjoyed a walk so we decided to come in here. It was busy, had to give the hostess number of party and our number to call. So finally half hr later. Went back. The hostess had to find a table. She said "ok we have a table upstairs" mind you it's three adults and two kids. So we go upstairs. She literally seats us in a table of 4 ALL the way in the corner like we were on punishment. These tables are super small and good for 4 people. My husband  is a big guy there was no way we can all fit in. So finally we decided to just get up and leave. When we told the "hostess" how can she seat 5 people in a 4 seat table she said that was all they had. Are you kidding. You couldn't tell us this the moment we decided to be on the waiting list. The hostess are terrible. They need to change up whoever is in the front dealing and figure out a better communication with the customers. It was pretty disappointing that was her answer instead of helping and wanting to make us happy.
Great atmosphere!  We have visited this place several ties, and at different times - always fun.  Food is good, and their selection of flavored margaritas is very creative.  Service is very good too.

This is a great place for happy hour any day of the week! There house margaritas are amazing (made with freshly squeezed limes), guac is yummy, and so are their tacos. If you find yourself in old town Scottsdale it is worth a stop in

The five stars are for: prompt service, pleasant and courteous staff, for placing a Mexico! flag on my taco, and for having hot salsa that was actually HOT! The atmosphere here is contagiously fun and with the skulls everywhere and mexican decor adding to the vibe, I felt I had been transported to Mexico minus being frisked by the border patrol.  The shrimp taco was full of zesty full-sized shrimps and was spicy. The shredded beef taco and the chicken one didn't disappoint either. Best of all the shells were fried and crunchy which added to the zesty tasty explosion going on in my mouth! I would definitely come back here if I were visiting Old Town Scottsdale again.  Edit: I believe the actual HOT salsa did cost $0.75 more... but definitely worth it if you're up to the challenge!

The nachos were so good... I am a picky eater but they were very accommodating... I was able to get my nachos with just chicken and cheese... The amount of nachos on the plate was insane... Two people could have eaten it....the margaritas were good too... The waiter was very attentive

Great white sangria and margaritas!!!  We went for dinner, but ended up ordering appetizers and a pitcher of white sangria. All I can say is the service was great but the drinks are amazing!!!  The tortilla chips  were fresh and homemade.  The ceviche was so tasteful!

This place is of the charts good. My bartender, Wyatt, was the most refined scholar and gentleman I have had the pleasure to be served tequila by.  The owner even stopped by to ask how I was doing. It was like I had known him for years.  I told him I was doing "f-ing great". I like to see an owner that gets out on the floor and gets his hands dirty.  All nice people serving very good food .  Get the cucumber margarita, but only if you want your life changed forever (in a good way).

Great margaritas, chips, and queso. Tacos were fine but nothing to write home about. My husband liked the enchiladas, though. Kid friendly but not a kid restaurant, which is our preference. We sat inside, but the patio looked fun as well. The server was nice but busy.

The reason for the 3 stars is because they really do have a killer happy hour and the location is great. Half off all appetizers until 7PM and discounted margaritas. I'm not a fan of margaritas but my friend ordered one and she said it wasn't bad. I ordered a blackberry mojito and it was the most tart drink I have ever had, would not recommend. Nachos were just alright. Guac was great!

I have been here twice and I am impressed. The salads here are amazing, and I love the atmosphere (especially the mango vinaigrette dressing), as it is very funky and bright. This looks like a great place for happy hour. I have eaten on the patio, and that is very nice too with lots of shade. I also had the chicken tortilla soup which was great with an avocado slice in there and a small drop of sour cream. It had a nice kick of spice! The prices are great and portions are hefty!

Comparable to my favorite Mexican restaurant back home, this authentic eatery features a wide selection of traditional favorites and a good selection of beer, cocktails, etc. We were seated outside in an alley way type setting which had a very nice feel to it. Though it was a chilly desert night, they had propane powered, heated lamps keeping guests warm. They also provided free chips and salsa with not one, but two distinct flavors - mild verde and a medium traditional salsa. The chimichanga I had was a new taste for me compared to the same dish I had back at home. The meat was rich and flavorful and not mushed like back home in NJ. Great presentation on it and two different sauces as well (server offer each one or both...both, duh).  My wife had a chicken quesadilla and she enjoyed it as well. We are only spending a weekend in Scottsdale and the restaurants we pick are somewhat of a hit or miss but this was definitely a nice hit. We enjoyed it and didn't find out until later the popularity of this place.   Recommended for any first time visitors to the area and of course the locals too. Good shopping in area as well. Easy access to dessert across the street at the infamous Sugar Bowl of Scottsdale.

I typically hate everything in Old Town, but who can hate a Mexican restaurant that's open late, serves a huge variety of drinks, has great and imaginative tacos, can accommodate those who eat clean.  The lean green bowl is black beans, Greek yogurt, roasted veggies, tomatoes and lime quinoa. It's outstanding and even better with shrimp for a few bucks more.  Ahi tuna tacos also are terrific.

Wow - how have I walked by this place on so many vacations and not stopped in? It blows other Scottsdale Mexican food out of the water.   If I lived here, I would be there every Monday for shrimp tacos (2 bucks!!!) and 6 dollar BEER-A-RITAS - they have taco Tuesdays as well... Both types of shrimp are amazing - one is just grilled shrimp and rice - simple but tasty - and the other is kinda of a fried Asian-y shrimp with cabbage, also killer.   I didn't like their other stuff as much, but still good. The carne asada was steam, just nothing to write home about,. I really liked their crispy chicken taco, and the chorizo and potato taco is a great idea but falls flat because the chorizo is sort of bland - which is strange for a place I found all their food to be sort of spicy.   Came back for lunch our last day before leaving, I will definitely be back! .
Waitress was wonderful, music not too loud, habanero margarita was delicious and the tacos were meal sized!  Great spot!
Food fun and great service totally recommend. Really a fun place don't let the name fool You very family friendly appreciative and accommodating

My Husband and I stopped into the restaurant for lunch on a January afternoon.  We were greeted by our server Ashley who was very friendly.  I started with a Habanero Margarita and it was great and I also had an organic margarita which was also good and not too sweet.  The Camarones A La Diabla  and the Taco Al Pastor were both great choices.  My husband and I also had a flight of Tequila and our server put it together for us with the most popular, server favorite and bartender favorite.  They were very good choices.  There is 100 tequila selections ranging in price and it was nice to have a server that seemed to be knowledgeable on tequilas.
Best service! Even on taco Tuesday when its absolute chaos inside! We had the best tacos and margaritas served by bartender and server Danielle! Will definitely be here more often!

I happened upon this place via UberEats one Saturday night. Ordered the fajitas and was pleasantly surprised by how good they were. The vegetables were good perfectly and the entree had a nice charred flavor that I like.   I have ordered a few additional times through UberEats, but only after I called to ask them to become available on the app. I would continue ordering from them, but I'm not going to keep calling to ask them to turn on the app.

My wife and I chose Cien Agaves for lunch during our visit to Old Town Scottsdale.  We found it was a great spot for lunch.  I found the interior very bar-like and pretty loud but that's fine for lunch.    I was really impressed by their tequila selection and we had two fabulous margaritas during lunch.  My wife absolutely loved the cucumber margarita.  I was a bit skeptical but I did enjoy it.  Especially considering it was 108 outside!     The ceviche was really tasty but the shrimp could have been cut up smaller.  It kept falling off our chips and was much larger than the rest of the ceviche.  We had three different tacos and all were really good and not your typical fare.  I'd say the Taco al Pastor was my favorite but my wife really enjoyed the veggie tacos with the sauteed veggies for the filling.  The other thing to note about the tacos was that there were at least 10 different types.  I wanted to try them all out (just like the margaritas) but that'll have to wait for another time.  Don't know how this place would do for dinner.  I'd highly recommend it for the margaritas and the tacos were good but it's more of a casual place.  The price also seemed okay considering how good the margaritas were but it's not cheap.  We spent $50 for 2 margaritas, 3 tacos and the ceviche.  We had good tequila in the margs so there were in the $9-11 range.  We would definitely come again.
Their fajita bowls are my fav healthy-ish meal in old town and it's still very tasty! Monday's have great deals as well!

A few friends, my husband and I met up here on a Friday night for dinner and drinks. Arrived before happy hour ended, so enjoyed some guac and chips and a Dos Equis before the real meal. I had a fajita salad with chicken. The lettuce and veggies were fresh and the mango-pineapple vinaigrette was great! My husband had 2 Tinga tacos and they seemed a bit small; you'd think 2 tacos would be enough to fill you up but he was still hungry after finishing them. We stayed for almost an hour and a half just enjoying each other's company and the service was good the whole time.

We've been to Cien countless times since my initial review of the place over three (!) years ago. Food is always consistently good and service can usually handle any issue/crowds. We dropped by last spring during a gigantic street fest and even though we were wedged in a corner on their top floor, we still received food and drinks with prompt service.  BUT, what gave me pause on our most recent trip is a new addition to their menu: BOWLS. ("bowls, bowls, all types of bowls...chips and mints and seashell bowls")   More specifically: The Beats by Cien (cute) bowl. You guys, this is a freaking treat, and one you wouldn't expect to stumble upon in a little taco shack in Old Town: roasted red and gold beets, grape tomatoes, grilled corn and chimichurri are all mashed around in some avocado and served upon a bed of shaved sauteed-warm Brussels and dried cranberries. The flavors and textures are outstanding. I think my beloved papas con queso tacos have competition in my heart, and it's this meal.

Taco Tuesday is my one of my main reasons for living. They have an amazing happy hour on Tuesday where tacos are $2 and house margaritas are $3.50. If you need a good place to be obnoxious and talk shit, this is the place as it is LOUD. During their rush, service can be kind of slow and you have to ask for free chips and salsa to be delivered to your table. (I am of the mind that all restaurants, Mexican food or no Mexican food, should serve free chips and salsa. But I digress.)   For the price and the location, you can't beat it. Thank you Cien Agaves for helping me tolerate the rest of  my work week after getting drunk on your extremely cheap and tasty margaritas on Tuesdays.
Always a great time at cien! From the service to their food you can't go wrong with anything. Try their taco stand they have a variety of tacos to choose from. Great happy hour EVERYDAY 3-7
Great food! Great staff! Great service! It's a small place that gets very busy so be patient when waiting but the food and drinks are so worth it! We will be back!

Not a huge fan. I'm one for good service and this place wasn't it. It took the server 20 minutes to come greet us and take our drink order. Server never gave her name or the specials for taco Tuesday. We had to go to the bar to get water and call her over to get our check. The food was amazing however. The house margaritas weren't anything special.. A little to sweet for my liking.

Fantastic margaritas complemented by excellent food selections. A healthy variety of tacos which can be mixed and matched. The chimichanga was just the right level of spice. And, oh the great margaritas. Highly recommend the Cadillac. And save room for the desserts. This is an excellent night life hang out on weekends, or a pleasant dinner for two during the week.

This place is definitely 5 Star's.  Traditional Mexican food with your average atmosphere seems to be the standard here in the valley.  Cien Agaves goes above and beyond and really doesn't even compare.  Their taco's are amazing!  Except for a few apps, I haven't even tried anything else that's how good their tacos are!!  Their fresh squeezed lime Margarita's are mouth watering.  Atmosphere and Service were both top of the line.  Trust me... I'm a native of AZ and have been to many Mexican Food Restaurants... GO TO CIEN AGAVES!!!  You wont regret it!

Went there for Taco Tuesday and was surprised when they asked us if we had a reservations.  We got a seat right away in the self-seating bar area, but it was the last table available.  Cool atmosphere and decor.  Only had the margaritas and chips and salsa.  Chips and salsa was good.  Margaritas were a bit sweet, but they were large and only $3.50.  Seemed like a fun little place, but I hated my date.  I'll go back there and explore a little more when I'm with people I like and I'll update my review accordingly.

went here tonight. great place in old downtown Scottdale. i got the fajita bowl with a beer garita and both were great. service was just as good and pricing was reasonable while leaving with a full stomach.
Food was OK at best but the vibe is cool. Was a bit empty for a Friday night. I don't think I'd return but was worth a visit!

My husband and I finally made it to Old town Scottsdale and saw this taco place right away. We were not disappointed, the tacos were great and not to high priced concidering where we were. Will definitely be back.

Lunch on Friday, March 9. Two tacos with rice and beans for each of us. One margarita for each of us. Taco plate was overpriced, but I knew that when I ordered. God bless them for getting as much as they can. However, as tasty as the tacos were, the beans were in need of more salt and the rice was BARELY room temperature. The homemade margarita mix was delicious, but how about being able to recognize that there is some tequila in them - must have been the smallest shot glass on earth. Service was good and the ambience was excellent. If I want a taco, I'll go back for happy hour when they're $3, not $4.75.

OMG the happy hour special is great, and their tacos are DELICIOUS!  Not to mention the tequila selection.  KILLER shrimp taco.  I could have eaten my weight in those suckers!  Nice service.  Its dark but spacious.  Nice place for a quick meal and some venom...

If you're coming for drinks (specifically for margaritas), this is the place. Cien Agaves has a large amount of tequilas and variety of margaritas at a reasonable price.  The tacos are just OK and I feel that they're a bit small for the price. Some, (salmon for example) were tasteless.  The chips and salsa were delicious and I love that they give you both a green and red salsa.  All in all, it's much better than Salty Senorita.

Hear ye hear ye, no booze in the happy hour margarita ! If you're gonna have one you best be getting an extra shot of tequila to add to that or snap... You won't feel a buzz . The menu specifically says all margs are made to order however I watched this come out of a pre mixed jug. No Bueno victor ;)

I typically love this place but we went last weekend and had the slowest and crappiest service I've had at a restaurant in quite a while. They were out of certain menu items, took forever to take orders or come to check on us, didn't follow through with requests, we were there for 3.5 hours with no water service, had to ask for a to go box 3 times. Slow and really really poor attitude. Food was decent, the usual.
Appetizers were half price!!! Ceviche was delicious Queso with pork Chorizo pizza Shredded chicken taco! It was sooo good!!!

I have ordered a grilled mahi mahi taco and grill corn for side. This is absolutely stunning. Fish was grilled to perfection and corn has a nice char and sweet. This is one of the place that I will definitely come back for. Restaurant environment was comfortable. Nice ambiance music and just at the right volume. Friendly service. What else can you ask for when you are hungry at night.

I had an amazing time at Cien Agaves during my visit to Arizona! Not only are the margaritas AMAZING but the wait staff and management are absolutely incredible. The atmosphere is relaxing and I loved the decor. I cannot wait for my next trip out to Phoenix so I can enjoy the wonderful company and delicious margaritas!!!

Cien Agaves is a very nice Mexican restaurant in old town scottsdale.   Margaritas were very good and refreshing on a hot summer day like yesterday and the food was delicious.   There were plenty of choices for vegetarians like me.  "Service with a smile" definitely made the experience an awesome one and will definitely go back again!!

Truly bad service. I'm visiting from out of town and after confirming the reservation they 'called' to cancel. As I'm living abroad couldn't get the message and happens that they were 'apologetic' but we just were left without a reservation  Very underwhelming

I love this place! When we went for lunch the place was relatively empty, but filled up quickly. Their shrimp tacos are amazing! I would get them again in a heartbeat. Queso dip is a must and a nice cold margarita! They have so many margarita options an the service was great. I would go back any time!
Great margaritas and amazing tacos. I recommend the carnita's taco. I hope to get back to Scottsdale soon so I can stop by again.
The Beets by Ren Bowl was really good. The fish taco and taco salad were pretty plain. The regular margarita was too sweet. I liked the skinny margarita (asked them to not make it sweet).

This will be a quickie. I stopped in last night with a friend to see if this place was any good and worth checking out again. We had already eaten, so we just had chips and salsa and a margarita. I plan on returning to sample the menu, but until then I'm giving this a pass fail sort of review.  It passed.  Service was good and the place is nice inside. The chips and salsa were okay. I wasn't blown away by the salsa, but I enjoyed it. That's more than I can say for most places. The house margarita was merely okay as well. Nothing special. It was served in a stupid shaped glass which was annoying, but I drank it and can't complain.  I'll return sometime soon for a full meal, but I'm not going to bank on this place topping my list of great Mexican food. The search continues.

Have been coming to Cien Agaves for quite some time now. Food has always been consistently good, and so has the service. I usually bring family here when they come into town. The chicken tinga tacos are not like my mom's but they are definitely amazing. i HIGHLY recommend the chorizo cheese crisp, if they still have it. Of course, lets not forget the margaritaaas!

This Old Town Scottsdale Bar and Grill is a great place to watch a sporting event on a big screen TV. The happy hour menu is an obscenely good deal, and you can easily get a full meal for a fraction of what you would expect it to cost. The eclectic atmosphere gives this place some personality, and the staff is very friendly.

Mayb need to b back for happy hour to see if I can up my rating, but for now this is all!   Ambience - ok  Service - meh Margarita - meh Food - meh Price- ok, but for bad quality they offer it's high  We had a bad waitress, I think her name was naomi, never introduced herself, found it on the check, which was the only time she actually smiled, bcs ofc she needs tips, but for what? She never made me feel welcome, didn't make my day any better, screwed up my order & never spent an extra second with me? In fact towards the end I asked the helper boy for everything and gave him a few $ tip.   I got a cucumber margarita after reading recommendations, which was just meh. Probably would hav been better if frozen. The price doesn't justify it. Macayos or ze tejas has Better ones.  I am a vegetarian, so decided to get veggie fajitas with black beans and corn tortillas. Fajitas were so bland and had no flavor whatsoever. I could stir fry these veggies in my home to taste better. Even a sports bar like Gallaghers has better fajitas than here. Black beans was a disaster, it was just cooked bland beans, no flavor, no salt, nothing at all. Is this supposed to b a joke, or they don't care much about vegetarians? Bcs my gf loves her meat tacos. I am defntly hoping to hear from the owner/manager about this!!   And ofc the corn tortillas never arrived, instead came the flour tortillas, down went my calorie count. Thanks cien agaves, not sure why u r trying to copy tortilla factory? Not coming back soon, unless forced to!!  Check the posted pics along with review

We live in Old Town and have been on several occasions over the last month. Great happy hour with freshly made guacamole and appetizers half price. The servers are cheery even when there is a large crowd. For those of us who like the Tex Mex variety this will whet your appetite. The cheese enchiladas are delicious and the menu has many taco choices. Wish they had beer on tap, but the house margaritas are special. Ask to sit in the courtyard, it is a sliver between two buildings with a great atmosphere, heaters and a fire pit. It is a great place to bring friends which we plan to do next week. Two types of salsa for salsa fans, red and green. Great job Cien A

The Queso Verde here was pretty good, and given what I've tried, their appetizers in general are up to par. However, the Tinga tacos were not completely cooked, and the corn tortillas were a bizarre consistency (not as soft as flour but not very crunchy either). All in all, definitely not a go-to for Mexican food.

Wasn't expecting much for this restaurant, but we were blown away! Happy hour was great - especially the margaritas! All dinners were large portions and everything tasted fresh. Very reasonably priced as well. Would recommend for anyone!!

I had a lunch with some friends over $1 tacos.  The scenery, the tacos, the grease...all good.  $1 fried tacos were well worth every penny.  Crispy fried tacos.  Not an every day indulgence but tasty nonetheless.  The place has a bit of a funky atmosphere, the service was very good.  I would return for Tuesday $1 Tacos.  I am betting Cien Agaves is pretty busy on Friday & Saturday nights.  Did I mention the $1 tacos were fried?  Very filling.  That was the first time I've had fried tacos.  And I thought tacos were nearly a perfect food.
Dry tacos. Slow service. Great atmosphere.   This literally sums up our experience. Wish I would have looked on Yelp before eating here.

Tonight was my first visit to Cien Agaves. I met a group of people for happy hour. The decor is nice and the patio is awesome! they even have a fire pit. This however, is where the positives end.   I arrived at 550. I finally was able to pin down a server at 615. I ordered a house margarita, a shrimp taco, and a chicken taco. At 645 other people who arrived after I placed my order receive their food. I said something to the person who brought their food about how long it was taking for my tacos and he respond in a rude tone "the kitchen is very busy". I explained that I had ordered 15 minutes before the food that had just arrived and he just walked away. A while later (655) my tacos came out and the ingredients inside the tortilla were cold. The margarita was watered down and the cold congealing tacos were mushy and salty. Very very disappointed.
They have quite the tequila menu. The tacos are real good. Chips n salsa was good.

I can appreciate a good happy hour, and Cien Agaves certainly has a muy bueno one.  While I didn't come on Taco Tuesday (which I should have for their $1 tacos and $2 Tecates), I did come for Margarita Monday (ok, I made that up - margaritas here are a must every day of the week). We came in before their daily happy hour ended at 7pm and enjoyed some awesome house margies for half price - $3.50! And these suckers were pretty big too.   Food was delicioso. I had a carnitas burrito and went with our server's rec to get it enchilada style and got the spicy red sauce. I'm glad I did, because it was so good wet (hmm, TWHS). Their signature chicken fajitas were really tasty as well. Entrees were so big that I couldn't imagine getting any appetizers or dessert - although an after dinner shot of tequila? Si, senor! Obviously, they had a list of cien tequilas on their menu. As much as I love Clase Azul, we decided to get shots of Milagro Anejo and saved ourselves $400.  All in all, a fun spot in Old Town Scottsdale to get your Mex fix!

This is a fun place to go for casual Mexican food. Their margaritas are amazing. It's nice to see them use fresh lime. The staff is fun and I always have a good time when I go here with my friends.  The chicken tacos are my favorite
Chips and tacos are must haves - the margaritas looked great as well! Chipotle chicken quesadilla was okay. Stay away from the sangria- wasn't fresh or that good. Overall above average!
Great food, happy and helpful staff and fantastic happy hour prices! A must see anytime you're in Old Town Scottsdale!

Food is great, drinks are great, happy hour was great.... However, I wasn't a huge fan of the "service." When we got there we were offered a booth, but we had to be done before an hour as they had a reservation. So, because we didn't want to feel rushed we agreed to either wait or go to another table; they seated us in the bar area at a high top. It did take forever to get chips and salsa but that's the only complaint that I have regarding the actual service at the table..... However, as one of the bartenders checked on us to see if we needed anything else, we ordered another round of drinks and were then informed that they had a private party coming in and they wanted to clear the area within 15 minutes. So, basically, hurry up and get out...   I mentioned the fact that it happened when we first got there and the bartender laughed it off and continued on.... Honestly, I felt as if our patronage was not appreciated and we were a bother.
This is how you do it.  Walk to the bar.  Order 3 island shrimp tacos with flour tortillas and a Cadillac margarita.  Then sit back and mark this review as useful.
Love it, I visit every time I come to town. Excellent margaritas and decent food. Reasonably priced and great happy hour specials! Solid 4-star!

This place has some of the best tacos at the best price possible especially on tuesdays. Margaritas are my jam here as well. Their watermelon margarita is my fav because they use fresh watermelon juice compared to other places that uses watermelon flavored sugar syrup. The manager Jami came by and checked on me which was awesome because that shows the people who run this place care about their customers. Love it here.
Great happy hour deals, great margaritas, great service. Definitely could become my favorite.

My friend and I ate a decent lunch here. Although, it wasn't the best or even second best taco place I've been too. Taco Tuesdays only refer to one taco on the menu, that being shredded beef. We ordered four shredded beef tacos, two fish tacos.   Tip: you may order soft corn tortilla tacos instead of the hardshell for the shredded beef. I preferred the fish taco over all the dishes I tried. In the end, I just picked out the meat and veggies and did not eat the rest of the soggy tortilla.   We also ordered the house margarita. It was very satisfying! As it was a hot day, it did quench the thirst. Other than that, I'd say I would only come back for happy hour or if everything off the menu was half priced

Decent meal. Probably will not be back, the queso definitely has Velveeta in it, I don't care what they tell you. (We did not ask). It was tasty, but that was the Velveeta. Tacos and chimichangas we're good, margaritas were OK, with a visit if you're hungry, but not one to wait for. We were hungry and wanted to eat now and we got what we paid for and what we were looking for. Really lovely service.
Really delicious and fun place! I came with my family (group of 8) and it was so crowded so I'm glad I made a reservation. It had a fun party vibe, but still great for dinner!

My first response to parking in front of Cien Agaves was "what in the hell am I doing in tourist land?" Old Town is such a piece of shit. Unless you like fake western hokey crap stores and indian flute music, you'll want to barf. Of course, when you walk into Cien Agaves, you're transported to a different type of atmosphere instantaneously.   They score with Moises' art on the walls, with the industrial looking staircase in the middle of the restaurant, and the generally good soundtrack. There are parts of the restaurant that feel like the divey little places you'd find in Guadalupe, and other parts feel like a Tempe college kid bar. None of it, however, feels like a nice restaurant. The diamond plating in the restrooms is oddly reminiscent of a shotty strip club.   The food here was about what I would expect. Not as good as The Mission, Barrio Cafe, Los Sombreros, etc. But much more interesting than a place like Los Olivos. They offer about a dozen different tacos with all sorts of seafood, meat, and bird. Service on my visit was a little slow. We waited about 15 minutes for our check and finally asked for it. Who knows how long we would have waited otherwise.   My main observation while here was the crowd. Even though the restaurant feels like the divey Tempe college kid restaurant, the crowd it draws is a little different. There were quite a few roided up douchebags with spider web tattoos, affliction shirts, and stupid gay shit eating grins with some fake tittied blonde with a nosejob hanging on them. It kind of seemed like a bar for Scottsdale douchebags when they want to "slum it" and have "mexican" food.  I'll probably go back eventually, but if you're looking for a place to have good Mexican food, skip Cien Agaves. If you want to sip a few Coronas and have some tacos and salsa, you'll be happy as a clam here.

Glad to say this place is still going strong a little over a year after my first visit/review. Wanna try it? Then visit on a Tuesday night for $1 tacos and $2 cervezas! They have amazingly good Tacos and Salsa, and an excellent Tequila bar. Do try the grilled corn on the cob.  Excellent place to hang all night with friends - great drinks, great food, great prices.

Extremely rude manager. I can't believe how she handled a particular situation. I enjoyed the food and the drinks but did not enjoy the atmosphere. If there is an issue approach it in an appropriate way. I can't say I'll be back.

Holy Tequila!  Luv the margaritas here!  House margaritas are the best.  I highly recommend the Cucumber margarita!  Its cool and refreshing with the perfect amount of tequila.  Great drink for the hot AZ summer!  Tinga tacos are my absolutely favorite.  Great crunchy chicken taco!  Great place in OT for some awesome food and drinks.  This is one of the best happy hour locations in town!
Very nice place! Loved the outdoor fire pit seating, our server Audra was adorable! Very attentive didn't forget a thing, loved the salmon tacos. Will be back

Came to Cien Agaves as part of a group lunch recently. Since they market themselves as the best tacos + margs in AZ, I was super intrigued to try them out. Thank goodness for my friends who get us together to try all these new-to-us places in the Valley!   They're in a cute + festive building in Old Town that is definitely reminiscent of the Wild West. I give them props for that. I left wishing I could give them props to their food + margs... there was a lot desired from them. Perhaps another visit is in order? ::shrug::   The servers were super kind since they had our group to deal with. By the time I arrived mostly everyone had ordered so they went thru the menu, their suggestions with me. I went with the highly-recommended AZ Prickly Pear Marg. It's so pretty! But not that good. I didn't want to bother the servers so I just kind of sipped on it slowly until we left instead of ask for another. I went with a chicken fajita salad too. Really nice presentation in a full fried tortilla bowl, but there's nothing really worth the $13 for it as it's just a standard bland salad with chicken. I wasn't terribly impressed either with their chips and salsa. That's hard to come by for me... but they did.
Tequila tasting can we taste some tequila next time.. was a fun experience but the tequila wasn't even a half a shot

I have been eating here for about 3 years and there is one thing that keeps bringing me back. The Tinga Taco.   The tinga is the single best taco I have ever had. Shredded marinated chicken thrown into a crispy shell then the whole thing deep fried. Throw in there fantastic chips and salsas and you got my favorite place to go in the valley for tacos.

5 stars for the margaritas alone!  The cucumber one is awesome!   I've only been there for food a few times and have been impressed every time. The salmon taco is pretty good.  For me, these are the best margaritas in Scottsdale.

The food was reasonably good but not good enough to prompt us to return. This restaurant's location make it a tourist eatery; we felt rushed through our meal. We ordered guac and chips and drinks to start, 5 mins later ordered dinner. The drinks & guac/chips (which were good) arrive 15 mins after we placed the order & our dinner (which was fair) arrived 2 mins after that. There was barely room on the table for the food, but what was more disappointing is we sensed the restaurant/server was more interested in quick table turnovers. She didn't even ask if we wanted dessert, but just brought out the bill. There are plenty of other Mex-themed restaurants in this city; the food here is not that special. This is not the place to chill and chat.

This place has a good vibe to it.  Their food is okay, nothing too special.  They do have specials during different days of the week.  I went on Tuesday for their shredded beef taco special for $1 a piece.  Like I said, nothing too great, but decent for what it's worth.  So when you go on a day they have a special be prepared to wait a few minutes.  For it being my first time there, I would have enjoyed it more if the waiter was a little more kind to the customers.  I'll give her the benefit of a doubt and say she was having a bad day.
We were seated upstairs which was extremely noisy. Could hardly carry a conversation. Food was good but we will only stay if we can sit outside.
Great atmosphere, food was great, staff was amazing, beergarita's are wonderful.

I love the decor, music and food. Its a casual spot with an amazing menu. I love the taco stand menu. The margaritas seem like there isn't any sweet and sour which is awesome because that syrup stuff makes my stomach hurt. The service is always attentive and prompt. I'd say the only area of improvement would be supplying guests with eating utensils. Nothing is worse that getting your food without something to eat it with. Its happened to me almost every time i go.
Great atmosphere in here. Half price starters during happy hour. The burrito was a touch dry but nothing drenching it in salsa didn't fix. I'll be back.

We came here with the local recommendation of our hotel concierge. Good place to get tequila with delicious tacos, he said. We came during lunch on Saturday so no happy hour and no drinks to vouch for.   We ordered the Pollo Asada Burrito and Tres Tacos combo. The burrito was good, not spectacular in the marinade. They kinda went light on the cheese and guac, but the black beans were delicious. For the tacos- we ordered Lobster, Mahi mahi, and shrimp. The shrimp tacos were my favorite. Extremely flavorful, and cooked perfectly. This place can add a little more lobster to the taco, and the mahi mahi was okay.  The service was quick and all the ladies were very nice. Food was mediocre though.
Such an easy place to enjoy for a relaxing drink and/or food.  The staff is always friendly, the drinks are good and food is tasty.  Cool, mellow little vibe in there.

If you're in old town and in need of good Mexican food and great service. This should be your stop. Whether it's just for their great happy hour with their bartenders (make sure you say hello to Michael Ann, she makes a mean Margarita) or joining them for their great taco Tuesday, you can't go wrong. My favorite is their burrito and a nice cold Dos Equis.  Love this place.
Great food, drinks and the customer service was excellent. Every time we go the food is amazing! They have a great happy hour and great bartenders! Their selection of seafood is impressive too!

Hands down favorite Mexican Restaurant in Scottsdale. The margaritas are the best that I have ever had and are extremely reasonable during their long happy hour. The tacos and appetizers are delicious.

Came in to check this place out and did not disappoint. Started our with the tequila flight which was awesome and ordered the chicken fajitas which came out extra hot. Can even see the steam in the picture. Delicious!! Becky was awesome and gave us great service. Will definitely come back to get the margaritas I keep hearing about
Delicious tacos, margaritas, and guacamole. Very good serving sizes too. Service was good and food came really quickly.

Came here with some girlfriends, after walking around the Old Scottsdale and taking in the character and desert sights. In the heat, all I wanted was a tall cool drink, maybe with alcohol. Ended up getting a Cien Agaves margarita for myself, which was quite good. If my girlfreinds drank alcohol , i would have ordered a pitcher they call  El Gigante.  Food was just very bland for me, and very pricey (but it is smack in the middle of a tourist area, so no surprise). ($4.95 for ONE taco - it better be Kobe asada, or Kurobota carnitas and premium Ahi tuna). Maybe that's the Arizona style for Mexican food, but it was not my thing.  Three stars for our very sweet-faced server, it would have gone higher if maybe we got our food and water sooner. Kitchen seemed really slow.

I came in to Scottsdale for the first time this weekend visiting family and came to this area to have dinner and decided on this place after walking around the area. We could have gone anywhere..Came in and got seated by the host immediately who was very friendly. Looked at the menu as we wanted to check out everything so after a time of watching our waitress Nikki standing and socializing and talking with some guys we were ready to order and waited. Ok fine. Food was delicious, so that's good. shrimp tacos and Ono fish tacos were great.  So I notice that Nikki didn't give us chips and salsa or ever bring it to our table! When I see every other table have them! And the other waitress was offering it the table behind us! Um really? Why didn't we get them? It's just showing how you could give a crap to bother. So lazy! I was pretty irked by that, then another person brings our food to the table while Nikki is still gabbing away with her co workers. Ok. We wait for a long time to get our check, until Nikki says she is going to get our checks out to the table. Then I see Nikki Run out the door to her friends on the street saying "I'm off!!!" Um, I'm still sitting and waiting for our check over 15 mins later.. I got up after Nikki was talking away with her friends outside and completely forgets about us. Hello??? I went to the front and asked the hostess to get her and give us our checks so we can leave! Does Nikki not take her job seriously?! To top it off her attitude was so obvious and rude I cannot believe it. Nikki in a huff ran to the back to get our checks. Gave them to our table so fast then ran off again without taking my money even! I am sorry I even needed to break change because she gave me about 5 effing nickels instead of a quarter. Why?! Give me nickels cuz you're mad I asked you to do your damn job?!! Idiot.  The hostess told me our waitress "mother was in town." Um what? She should have said I'm sorry I will get her right away! No Nikki you were not off work! and you should be fired for how you treated me and walking outside like we didn't exist! I wish we had the waitress behind us because she seemed very nice. If it's the end of your shift don't blame that on guests! Some people are not meant to be in the service industry and Nikki is one. Regret getting her as a waitress. And I want yelp to know. Fire her!!

Ode to Taco Tuesday   Cien Agave, how I love thee  Where else can I go to get tacos for free!?  Well, technically they are not free, but still  Only $1 a piece, it's an absolute steal!   Your Tecate Light is so refreshing and crisp  And at only $2, I can have multiple sips!  If darker beer is more your fare,  Have a Modelo, it's not that much more!   The tequila you serve makes your Margs quite delish  All food so divine, I have only one wish!  Only one day a week is not enough, I say  Let's celebrate Taco Tuesday EVERY DAY!   TT fans - this little poem sums it up! If you want cheap food and drinks, good service, cool ambiance, and just an overall place to go, Cien Agave's on Tuesday nights is the place for you!

This was our 1st Stop for dinner when we arrived in Scottsdale.  Taco Tuesday and Happy Hour!   We were not disappointed.  Tacos were delishous.  Drinks Outstanding. There is something on the menu that should please all who live Mexican food.
I ate here two days ago. Loved the guacamole. The appetizer options for happy hour were great
Place is amazing!!! Get the potato tacos. Service is always great. Happy hour margaritas are reaaaallllllyyyy bomb

Great find in Scottsdale. There's a lot of upscale restaurants in the area and Cien Agaves is more reasonably priced and they serve good quality Mexican. I'm pretty picky about Mexican food and really enjoyed the whole experience here. We stopped in on Monday night when the house margarita was half off and tacos were 2.50. I got a margarita and two tacos for 9.00!  It's also located in old town Scottsdale which is a fun area to check out. If you are looking for a more casual, comfortable spot in Scottsdale, stop here.
Service mediocre.  Food arrived cold and wasn't tasty. Totally overpriced for Mexican.

Chimichangas with a few tiny shreds of Chicken, mostly 99.9% rice filled. Tacos had total of one teaspoon of beef in them. If your looking for meat filled food, don't go here...they use all fillers yet charge the prices of what you'd expect to get in good quality food. Don't waste your hard earned money at this place.

The out-of-town family wanted Mexican, so we took them here. Since I don't eat meat, I'm not a fan of most Mexican restaurants because there is a limited selection for me. Here, the waitress recommended the shrimp and veggie tacos--both were great. And, I could even eat the refried beans (because there was no lard in it)! We all got Cadillac Margaritas and everybody was very pleased with their food. I also appreciated that they were so diligent about the reservation, a party of 8. They gave us a table upstairs that was private and spacious. For someone who doesn't typically consider getting Mexican food, it says a lot that I'm looking forward to going back here in the near future.

HOLY HABENERO LIME MARGARITA.     So I decided to man up and try this thing out after thinking about it many of times.  It was just as I expected hot and amazing.  After I was almost done though I was finishing my last sips when it happened.  I got a seed right into the back of my throat that was the painful moment that kept me away from ordering this thing before.  I managed to pull through though and finished it.    I also got the 3 taco meal and the tacos were great I had tinga, lobster, and chorizo and papas.  The beans were horrible but the rice was ok so just order the tacos without sides and save yourself a bit of money.

So good! The carne asada taco was amazing, shrimp Diablo taco was very good and the shredded beef taco was good but a little dry (needed more sauce). The habanero margarita was really good and not very spicy but the star of the meal was the churro sundae! SO GOOD!

Excellent food and service. The patio is excellent seating. The three taco deal is a good deal for $13.50. I told the server (Caitlin) to bring  me her three favorite tacos and she chose excellently. I had the Carnitas -- smoky and spicy, Island shrimp -- sweet and sour, and  a breaded fish taco that was excellent.the house margarita is good but they have a huge selection of margaritas and tequila. Excellent grub and value. Do it!

Thank you Cien Agave for celebrating teachers last night with your #redforedaz event. You are the first in our community to reach out for support. The service and food was excellent as always!  @Azedunited

Are we getting a few more visitors this year, or are my poor old ears deceiving me?   I think we are getting more visitors, based on the accents I'm hearing and the number of people clogging the entrance to my little lunch spots...reading the menus...gawking around...discussing all of their personal peccadillo's and preferences..."I dinna wanna fookin taco...I wanna go ta the fookin Breakfast Club" :-)  I think they were Scottish tourists, if I'm any judge of kilt's:)...and maybe soccer hooligans, too...although no soccer is being played in Scottsdale right now...spring training hooligans? :-)  I heard all that and more on Taco Tusday at CV, yesterday...an "elderly" lady from Baahstaahn (probably this side of 100, but well north of 90) complaining in a loud voice that the beef tacos were "tooo hawt...spaahcy hawt!"...imagine that...spicy food at a mexican joint:)  After detoxing with a pleasant little 6 miler along the mighty Scottsdale River, my buddy and I decided that we needed a little retox at Cien Agaves to put a spring back in our steps...I had 3 of the darling little $1.00 shredded beef tacos...my buddy had 11...that's right...11...at a sitting...for lunch:-)  He's 30 years younger than I am and he's a professional athlete... I remember the days before my MC4R gene started misbehaving and I could eat like that...damn genetics! :-)  If I did that kind of thing these days, you would need to chain saw out the wall of my home and use a crane to get me out of the house and onto set of "Biggest Loser":)  Yesterday was a nice day for a taco tuesday retox...great weather for the tourists...I heard a number of un-Scottsdale accents, dialects and languages on the street (as befits a tourist mecca like Old Town Scottsdale) and it looked like the turquoise and tee shirts were flying off the shelves so things are starting to pick up again:)  It's put me in such a good mood that I'm even willing to up my rating of CV to a solid 3.5 stars...although I still don't round up...sadly:)

We came in for dinner and had an awesome experience!  The staff is super friendly and helpful and the food was great.  I had the tacos and my friend had the fajitas.  Everything was priced right and we will be back many more times.  Great job!

Some of the best Mexican food I had while in Oldtown Scottsdale. They where open late on a Monday night where most of the area closes at 9pm and a couple at 10pm. Enjoyed the enchiladas and was a happy camper at the end of the night.

Yeah, I made it for Taco Tuesday!!! Wow, $1 beef taco's, my girlfriend and I put down 7 tacos with an appetizer. This place was great, very busy and a little loud, but we didn't have to yell at each other to have a conversation. The only bad part is our waitress was a little slow in getting us refill's and we asked for more salsa and didn't get it, but will definately be back for $1 beef taco's.
The food was amazing, tequila was too. We stayed for hours because the fire pit was so nice. If you're lucky enough to have Mel as your server you're in great hands!

I brought a group of clients for a happy hour to Cien Agave after a day of training. We had a reservation and they were great at checking in with us earlier in the day to make sure we were planning on coming and if we had any special request. We got there 15 mins early and BOOM, our table was ready! This gave them the 2 stars.  Unfortunately the food was the downfall. We all had tacos and they came out incredibly dry and flavorless, I am assuming they were left under a heat lamp a little too long. Probably the saving grace of our meal was the pork queso appetizer which was excellent. Maybe a couple extra margaritas before the food would of made it all taste better.

*Better than your typical Mexican Restaurant.  *The service was fantastic.  *Best happy hour *Try the house made margarita *Great for groups or eating alone *Located in a cute area that's great for walking
Great Mexican food, never disappointed. We did have a large group and it was a little slow getting more food but otherwise good.

This is a solid option for Mexican food and some drinks. Good atmosphere but it's kinda on par with Chevys...it is not the best Mexican or authentic but it was definitely good.   Chicken fajitas was tasty paired with a shot of patron and some tecate...bottom line: I'd come back next time im in town for spring training since it's right next to the giants Scottsdale stadium!
Great place and accommodating for kids. The prickly pear margarita was a hit with my wife!

Maybe we came on an off night.  I heard the Taco Tuesdays here were really fun and crowded.  But we came to a half emtpy restaurant and a cranky server.  The food was decent.  We had the shredded beef tacos ($1.50 each) and the complimentary chips and salsa.  Three tacos was enough for me, but I probably could have had a fourth.  Overall the facility is clean and nice, with big TVs all over.  However, it is a smaller buildilng which makes it feel somewhat cramped in here.  Maybe I will try again another time.

Went here with some out of town friends and liked it very much. We made it for happy hour, before 7pm, so the apps were half off. We got the guacamole and ceviche, which were probably the best part of the meal! Btw, Thanks to the yelper who told us we have to REQUEST the free salsa and chips that come with the meal, otherwise, we would never have gotten them! I ordered 2 chicken tinga $2 tacos and one grilled Ono taco. I really liked the Ono, but the tinga was just ok. My friends ordered the spicy shrimp taco and liked it. I would definitely come back another time, but make sure it was for happy hour!

I wanted to give this place five stars but due to the strange encounter with the host and hostess I can't. When four of us arrived at 4:30pm the hostess told us there was a 15-20 minute wait as we stood in an empty restaurant. They told us the kitchen was backed up and they couldn't seat any more people. We were fine with that and just wanted to sit down and enjoy a couple drinks. After some back and fourth one of them reluctantly took us to the island just past the bar threw down our menus and left. We could hear them griping about the situation from our table. It was just such a strange and awkward encounter I had a hard time enjoying my meal. After this however we had great service from our server and the food was delicious and incredibly fast considering the kitchen was backed up when we walked in. My favorite from the meal was the guacamole with pomegranate seeds on top. I would love to give this place another try in the future.

So this is becoming one my favorite spots for Happy Hour. The tacos are delicious as well as the Margaritas. My friend brought me here to try it out one tuesday when the tacos are $1 and now it is our place to meet up!

Taco Tuesday, half off appetizers and Cien Agave Margarita. Food was really good. The hostesses were not very friendly or helpful but once we got to a table it was worth the hassle. Tingas tacos, beef tacos, tostada and guacamole. YUM!!

-1 for the handful of gnats hovering above our table  -1 for the dingy smell inside the restaurant -1 for the dirty cloth napkins -2 for the awful tasting tacos ("lobster" and chorizo con pappas)*  -1 for the practically virgin banana colada  * lobster is in quotes because i highly doubt it was real lobster. it tasted more like what imitation krab is to real crab. oddly crunchy, chewy and trasparent.   i would've left if i were on my own, but i was with two friends that wanted to try it out and we had a groupon. personally, i never plan on setting foot in this place again. i want to gag just thinking about it!

Food was good. We sat outside in the little alley way which was super cute! The food was good. Our waitress was sweet but she kept forgetting about us. We had to ask other servers to help us a few times:(
Great Happy Hour.  Fresh ingredients cheap drinks and the best service ever today. Thanks! Happy hour till 7 not 6 like most places. Even on weekends not just Mon thru Fri.

A fine enough Mexican restaurant. Pamplona soup was very good, somewhat spicy. We shared the chicken fajitas. Plenty of food for two at a good price. But charge me $1-2 more and have some sour cream and guacamole on the side! Chicken had no real flavor. Friendly staff.

We recently had a casual wedding rehearsal dinner here for 50 people. From the Manager to the entire wait staff we were thrilled with the customer service. Our guests all complimented the food & we enjoyed having the upstairs area all to ourselves. Our new son in law goes here regularly for taco Tuesday.
Love that this restaurant supports local schools! Thanks for hosting a fundraiser for RedforEd!

Really good small plate Mexican place. The tequila and margaritas are on-point! The selections available very numerous and of the couple I have sampled are delicious. Taco selection is decent and the results are very flavorful and satisfying. I will be back.

Went on a Travelzoo voucher - what a find!!!!! The beer batter fish taco was great!!! Enoyed the Chicken Fajitas, the taco combo plates. Looking forward to going back, will get my own beer batter fish taco next time and not split it with my boyfriend :-)  The waitress told me they have good specials all week.  Only complaint was the rice was dry.

Outstanding taco's and tequila here!  They have over 100 brands of tequila and some of the best taco's I've had in a long long time.  I kind of expected it to be good, but not amazing, but I was wrong.  The food was way better than I expected.    I tried 3 different taco's from the 13 they offered, and all 3 were incredibly good.  The free chips and salsa were very good.  They had 2 different salsa's as well, the red was very good, but the green salsa was just incredible.  The bartender said the red just recently won a "Best Salsa in Phoenix" award from someone, but I was way more impressed with the green salsa (which I almost didnt try, as just by looking at it, you wouldnt think it would be good).  Pretty friendly environment inside and great staff.    I went for lunch, but it seems like it would get pretty busy for the bar crowd after dinner on the weekends, especially being right next to Patty's 1st Avenue Lounge.  Definitely a cool hangout, and a little nicer on the inside than I expected at least in terms of the tables, but then the booths and the bar seemed like more chill areas and more casual for sure.    I hope this place makes it and stays a long time.  They could use another TV or two in the bar area (at least downstairs), but thats hardly a complaint.  I was very impressed overall.  Definitely worth your time to go check out.

Lots to like at this spot.  Tacos can be good but unimpressive but this is a better result than most.   The fish tacos are flavored with a nice amount of kick.  I am a fan.  The atmosphere is chill and fun.  This is our second visit and we now look at it as a go to spot

Bad Americanized Mexican Food: 0 stars  Reeks of dismal chain restaurant.  Paying for the check now...couldn't wait to tell the Yelpers to stay away.  Food: 0-stars. The burrito I ordered came out with everything on the side, i.e. guacamole, beans, cheese. Only thing inside was rice and meat. Yet burrito was closed.   What??? So then it's a fajita right? The rest of my group shared other complaints.  Avoid at all costs.

Two words. Taco Tuesdays. Big night for the carnivores. And even though I'm now a vegetarian, I can still appreciate the beauty (from afar) of a $1 shredded beef taco. And did I mention the $2 Tecates and Dos Equis and $4 house margaritas all night? If your regular happy hour spot is packed, I'd recommend visiting Cien Agaves.   And apparently, each night is devoted to a different taco, with specials all week long. With an entire page of delicious taco options (including some yummy veggie-friendly options), this is your one-stop taco shop.   The chips and salsa are also tasty and plentiful. They bring you both the chunky, mild red salsa, and a slightly spicier tomatillo version. And the chips are reminiscent of those served at Aunt Chiladas, fluffy and delicious!

I went on a Thursday evening with family around 7:15 pm.  We had a fairly large group (about 25 people).    Cool atmosphere and the server was nice, however the service was very SLOW.  I had to ask 3-4 times for water before I received it.  It would have helped it there were more servers assigned to our group.  The food was decent. I liked the chips and salsa. For an entree I had a fish taco on a flour tortilla, it was fried fish (just ok).  I asked for extra sauce and that made it better.  I also had an ahi tuna taco on a flour tortilla, that was also good once I added the extra sauce.  My husband and I both ordered a house margarita, it was good.  I think the entire meal from start to finish ended up taking about 3 hours.  I really wanted to try the flan but since it took so long to get the meal, I was sleepy and ready to leave. Even getting our bill took longer than expected.

Swung by on a hot summer Saturday. I only got to see the downstairs, but it was nice and cool inside and the staff was really friendly. Great margarita. I got "the local" and it was delicious! Try it!!

I had the Island Shrimp Taco and the Tecate Fish Taco which were both delicious but very spicy for my taste. These were served with beans (black or refried) and rice. A bit pricy for the quality  since beans and rice are also a standard. Had the tacos been less spicy, my opinion of the quality might have changed.

Outstanding happy hour and fantastic food.  This is a regular place for me and my husband, visiting 1-2 times a week.  The "local" margarita is by far my favorite, not too sweet!  The grilled Ono taco is also my favorite thing on the menu! :)

Stopped in for lunch one day as we were driving through town. Our server was a trainee and she was pretty good, just a little green so things were a bit slower.   We got typical enchiladas and burritos. Food was good, but nothing outstanding. Their salsas were tasty but they charged more for some of them which is kind of odd but whatever.   Overall nothing was bad but I would not come out of my way to go here again.

I dislike reviews that mention partial stars...until I have to write one that hits a gray area, so there I am with Cien Agaves. Guilty with indecision and admission that I have to clarify my selection with a more accurate rating of 2.5 stars. Really, I have had better. And it's also ok. For the price and location in Old Town, it's not too bad.  The food is just ok (that is...rounding up to "just ok"). The chips and salsa are pretty good with the cumin-strong tomatillo standing out over the red. The guac is also nice and a bit too addicting. The tacos are nothing to rave about, and actually I'm not likely to order them ever again, but I've enjoyed a salad or two with grilled fish. While most people rave about the happy hour, the food options are meat-centric so not much to choose from on those deals for a veg/fish eater. But at least the margaritas are cheap.  The atmosphere on a weekend night is pretty energetic and the margaritas have a nice, fresh (aka no mix) quality. Not much by way of beer selection though. For diners that aren't super picky about Mexican food and don't mind the grease, this is a solid option. If you're more akin to the taste of say Gallo Blanco, meet your unpicky friends here and stick with the booze with some chips and salsa to tide you over.
Great tacos, super selection of tequila and good service.

Best. Taco. Salad. In. Phoenix.  Seriously, that stuff is amazing. This is probably because they make all of their own salad dressings. I get 2 or 3 of them on the side with every salad and that works so well for me. I get to taste a range of amazing flavors, appreciate the talent of their chef, while moderating the amount of extra calories I'm eating.  Another plus? The steak on it is amazing. Lean, pink in the center and tender! I really have to give it to them for producing such an amazing salad. Puts everyone else in PHX to shame.

I haven't been to this restaurant yet but I heard they support the RedforEd cause so I WILL be eating there soon. I've heard great things about this place so I'm looking forward to visiting and updating my review.

The food at Cien Agaves is really good.  I had the ceviche, which, despite containing shrimp as the only seafood, was really well seasoned; and I also had the ahi tuna tacos, which were delicious and filling.  However, I only gave 3 stars because the drinks were not that great.  I had a strawberry mojito and a mango margarita, and neither was memorable.

I know that lots of folks LOVE this place, and its tacos, but I just can't get there. My friends have raved about Taco Tuesdays, but the fact that the tacos are fried leaves me cold. I've tried multiple times to enjoy them, but I've had to give up. I guess your tastes just have to run in that direction...

Had lunch here recently. It was good enough to go back a couple of days later. It's a pretty typical Mexican restaurant. It wasn't the best Mexican meal that I've had but it was a good value for the price paid. The service was very good and it was at a pretty busy time.

This was a really good place for Taco Tuesday!  The tacos were a good size and very tasty.  The atmosphere of this place is awesome.  Two stories with a bar and bathrooms on both levels.  Will definitely go back.

I'm from the Southeast, so it's possible my standards for tacos and margs aren't as high as someone from the Southwest, but this place was awesome.  Husband and I stopped in for lunch, had the prickly pear and watermelon margaritas, queso, and tacos and an enchilada.  Everything was amazing...margaritas were perfectly mixed, fresh, not too strong or too sour.  Queso was excellent, as were the salsas, and my husband had a side of guac and said it was excellent as well.  Now the tacos...the shredded beef taco was maybe the best thing I've ever eaten.  I didn't even share a bite with my husband.  I think it ruined tacos for me forever.  Hubby had a couple of other tacos as well and loved both of them, I also had a cheese enchilada and it was very good...but overshadowed by the taco.  Very reasonably priced for the quality of the food.  Service was great as well, but we were there for an early lunch on a Friday and the restaurant was not busy at all.  Looking forward to coming back next time we're in town!

been here twice and probably won't go back, unless i only have margaritas. the food was great the first time and very sub-par the second, especially for the price of the tacos. the pork ones were especially gross; extremely greasy and fatty and tasteless (i know pork is fatty, but it shouldn't be hard to chew).   our service was good the first go round, as we sat at the bar and learned a lot from the bartender about their tequilas. the second time, service was no good. very slow and our waters went empty for entire meal, even after we asked for more.   they do have great guac and chips and their margaritas are fantastic, and they should be for what you pay. but if you are looking for great tacos, skip this place. you'll be underwhelmed.

I love the atmosphere in this restaurant but I think the food is pretty bland.  I've been here twice, I tried the big ass burrito with chicken and the carne asada tacos, I've had better though.  I do like their margaritas though especially the happy hour $3.50 margarita, you get the bang for your buck with the drinks.

Very, very good Mexican food! The good first...! Their specialty is tacos & they have all sorts to choose from. Best shredded beef taco I've ever had. The papas & chorizo taco was tasty too. I didn't care for the Diablo shrimp taco (which is odd because I LOVE guajillo chiles) but my husband thought it was great...to each their own! Fabulous & flavorful black beans.  The bad next...! I have never waited so long for chips & salsa at a Mexican restaurant ever in my life. In fact, I thought maybe we needed to order them but our waitress assured me they'd be right out.
