Ten minutes later we had to ask another waitress, who brought them out right away. Then we waited even longer for our appetizer guacamole. It was a little too tangy and topped with pomegranate seeds...just okay. Neither of my kids liked the food here. Both thought the Tinga chicken rolled tacos were too spicy. (I didn't think so.) They don't have any gringo items on the menu for kids or other picky eaters (& no ketchup). Of course, if everyone in your party digs Mexican food, this isn't a problem. We ordered 2 flour tortillas for the kids since they didn't eat any of their food. Then we had to wait 20 minutes for the tortillas to be delivered, but the waitress took them off the check due to the long wait. I don't know why she couldn't just call out the order instead of waiting for them behind big meal tickets, though. (I used to wait tables at a Mexican restaurant years ago.)  My husband and I will definitely be back. We'll just leave the kids at home next time!

Im no longer a big fan of getting Mexican food since my mom makes the best, and every restaurant is just second best to her. I found this place and made reservations online, since one sister wanted Mexican and the other sister that came along loves tequila I figured it was already a homerun.   Walking in its a very cool little joint. Very colorful and vibrant which I liked, and super clean. We got seated right away and I ordered a Guacamole and our drinks to get us going while we figured out what we wanted. They brought out salsa and the guacamole and chips. I love Salsas and as long as you don't try to get too nuts you can make some of the best just with a few ingredients. Unfortunately, these 2 salsa mild and hot were neither hot nor good... They were very sweet and yugh! The Guacamole was very bland. I feel like they just mashed Avocado with some pomegranate drizzled on top, it needed some lime, cilantro, some salt.. You know the basics!   We got our tacos and yes!!! They were actually pretty damn good. I got 2 shredded beef and 2 carne asad and they were delightful. We asked if they had some salsa in the back that was HOT (which most Mexican restaurants do). They did bring some out and with the chips it was pretty weird tasting, but inside the tacos it was delish! It was super spicy just like I love it.   Last thing that surprised me was the Bill... I have never been charged for salsa... Like ever....... This place charges $1.50 for a small cup of Hot Hot salsa, and we had 2 of them. Its not that I cannot afford 3 dollars its just seriously.... $1.50 Each Salsa!!! I was just surprised by this. I would have gotten it anyway if they would have told me up front its just more that I have never been asked to pay for the chip salsa.... At least it made out Tacos complete.
Ok tacos and margaritas.  Nothing to write home about

Delicious tacos, unique and tasty margaritas, great casual and energetic vibe. Our server, Dominique was fantastic.  (Try the beets bowl - so good.) check this out for moderately priced delicious food!

Look, coming from the east coast I was never huge into Mexican food.  But let's just get real here....this place is THE BOMB.COM!  It's a tiny little spot tucked away in Old Town in a strip mall so it's pretty random.    From the moment that Cucumber Marg touched my lips...it was over.  Right now they also have the Cantaloupe Marg that is new for the summer and it is also glorious.  I mean, the only one I haven't liked was jalapeno and that's only because I don't like a hot kick to my beverages, I like them to refresh me not kick me! ;)  They also have the tequila challenge which I have yet to begin, but one day I will start !  You can get on the plaque as well as a t-shirt.  Legend says, if you go one step further you get happy hour (or half price, I can't remember) drinks for life!    Their street tacos are also D'LISH!  My favorite is the Tinga, shredded yummy chicken with their sauce and cabbage! Amaze.  I have tried the majority of them and have not been dissapointed.   When it's nice out the patio is cute and quaint, not a bad spot to post up having some margs.  Otherwise, the vibe inside is also pretty great.  Bright and vibrant plus you can actually see the crowd rather than the alley outside where it's a bit more intimate.   Overall, this place is BOMB - TRY IT !

This was only our second time visiting as we come from Vancouver Canada but yet again it was AMAZING!  This time hubby had the chimichanga and I chose the 3 tacos with rice and beans. I had a super hard time deciding on which 3 to choose as they all sounded better than the last. I finally decided on a carne asada, pollo asado, and the tecate fish taco. The fish was by far my fave with the carne asada a close second. The waitress was friendly, attentive and helpful in giving me the low down on the tacos. Next time I will order al la carte since there was waaaaay too much food for me to eat.  When we are staying in Scottsdale in a few days we will returning to have the churro sundae since there was no room to eat it this time!

Decent but not great...The shrimp on my Diabla Shrimp taco were cold, but decent flavor. Tinga Taco just OK.  Guacamole was pretty good...but portion should have been larger given price. Rice side dish was pretty bland...and my kids mentioned this too (ok, being from San Diego maybe I'm a little spoiled with some great Mexican food). There is probably better for the money.

Huge selection of tacos.  Carne asada, pollo asada and carnitas tacos all great. Ahi tacos we're huge with fresh seared ahi.  Loved my cucumber mint margarita...super refreshing on a hot night.  My son was disappointed in his Big Ass Burrito with green sauce...said it was average.  Go here for the tacos!  By the way, if you like really spicy salsa with your chips, you need to ask for it.

When you go to a place that's named Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila, you expect your food to take like Mexican food, right?  Not the case here.  I ordered the Lean Green Machine (made vegan by excluding the yogurt) and, aside from it not tasting like Mexican food, the dish was executed poorly. Everyone at the table oohed and aahed at how pretty my dish looked, and commented on how it looked like it must have tasted so good...but was boring. Even more boring was the small amount of alcohol they put in their margaritas.  Come on guys, I can only fit so much in my stomach, I don't want to drink 10 margaritas in order to get a tiny buzz.  Meh overall!

First time visitor to the restaurant.  Made the reservation thru open table.  Seated quickly, place was VERY busy because of the Golf tournament.   Staff was great, service was good, food was fine.  Cien Beet Bowl, was AMAZING.  Enjoyed the experience.  However, do NOT allow them to seat you on the second level.  VERY VERY LOUD because of low ceiling and poor acoustics.  Take the first floor or patio but don't sit upstairs.

the service what horrible. Come on. That is part of the reason we go out to eat. Bad experience. The Food less than expected.  Im not saying this to hurt the business but to help them understand this is not how you treat customers. Food - salsa was watered down. The food was just ok.
If you're in a touristy old town, you can' be surprised by a tourist trap.  Margaritas were strong, but food was overpriced.

This aint' the Ritz, but it is a cool place to grab grub after a Spring Training Giants game.   My son and I had nachos (high quality, btw) and beer after a game.  Perfect.  We'll be  back next year.  Go Giants!
Casey is an awesome bartender/server. Best burrito I ever had. A must stop place when in Scottsdale.
The food was excellent.  We had the guacamole with the pomegranate on top. We sat outside to get some sun in before our flight back east.

Stopped by for late lunch on the way to a conference. Excellent tacos. Tinga chicken was my favorite. Waitstaff was awesome. I commented to my colleague that it's the only time I can remember the waitress taking my order and not writing anything down and getting it 100% correct.

Came here to try something new. Maybe we should have stuck to our favorites. The water they serve here tastes like it came out of a garden hose, no amount of lemon could save it. After ordering drinks, we waiting what seemed to be a lifetime for the waitress to come back to ask questions about the menu and order. My bf ordered the shrimps tacos but got fish tacos. He ate what he continued to eat them because the waitress never came back to check on the food. He thought they were the worst tacos he had ever had. He did not finish them. Something had got to be pretty bad for him to leave food on his plate. The only time I would ever come back here would be for happy hour but even then probably not.

Taken to Cien Agave for a belated birthday celebration. Wanted to go here as they have Happy Hour EVERYDAY from 3-7. Headed over on a Sunday that was mildly busy. The group enjoyed house margaritas, cheese crisps, tacos ... All on the happy hour menu... And a chicken chimi that wasn't on the HH menu. Service was a little slow at times but once we brought it to our server's (Mila) attention, things improved. Server spilled salsa on the table...and us, but she recovered nicely. I would come back and would recommend this place.  Written by Knife of Knife N Fork/Fork N Knife. Be sure to check out the reviews of my critic in crime, Fork.

Typical Mexican influenced bar with tacos. A little run down, but casual and down to earth. It has a rustic feel to it, and offered lots of seating. The ridiculous amount of tequila offered at the bar definitely draws in customers. Quite a sight to see! The food was mediocre, tacos and burrito were OK, nothing special. The rice tasted a little burnt and the black beans were the best part. Though the shrimp were cooked to perfection, they got it right!

Stopped in after a spring training game, and was happy to see I made it in time for happy hour!  $3.50 house margarita, and it was tasty :)  We were sat right away and after drinks were brought chips and salsa.  The salsa was amazing!!!  It was so good, my whole family liked it, we polished off the basket in no time.  I ordered the chicken fajita bowl, it was really good and inexpensive, only $9.  The rice especially was delish, authentic with a bit of kick.  The kids burritos were a good size for the price and milk for them was only $1.  All and all a great stop for dinner.  Kid friendly but still adult and fun atmosphere, good food and good service.  They also had TVs everywhere, so we were able to watch basketball.  Great location and in an easy to walk area. For our family, it was a good choice!  Enjoy!
